status_message:
Interesting Read:  

Fallout

August 2, 2015

April 30th, 1997, was the night the episode aired when Ellen came out in front of America. June 28th, 2015, the Supreme Court legalized same sex marriage. Eighteen years, one month and 29 days. That's how long it took the fallout I expected after watching the episode to arrive.

Since the Supreme Court's decision I have been in a bit of a daze I suppose. In a matter of hours I watched as FB became a rainbow parade before my eyes, and watched people I know declare how happy they were people were finally getting what they deserved. I had an over whelming desire to grab each one by both ears and say "But what about the kids?! Did you ever stop to think about the kids?! What about what they deserve?!" I didn't waste my time though because most people can't seem to see through the garbage propaganda they've been fed by the media and entertainment.

Admittedly, a lot of people on my FB have no idea my mom is gay. Let alone how I feel about it. And because I'm still trying to protect my mom and my family, I have hesitated saying much at all about my stance there. The one time I did share an anti-gay marriage article, I received a very hostile personal message from a family member accusing me of being disrespectful, and a holy roller. While I have religious beliefs, my position on this stems from my personal experience first, and my religious beliefs second. I don't have to use religion to defend why I think gay marriage and gay parenting is wrong, and to date, I haven't.

That family member ended up unfriending me shortly thereafter, which is fine I suppose.

Another family member, on the other hand, was scrolling through her feed one day and came across a familiar face. It was a link to an interview I had done with CBN. She was very supportive of what I had said in the interview, which was a huge relief.

Coming out and speaking about this has not been a cake walk. I have been called horrible names, ridiculed, and stressed out at times beyond anything I had previously experienced. I have put relationships that I cherish on the line and risk losing so much. But at the same time I know that kids like myself have to do this because no one else can, and in some ways, few others will. I have come to better understand how the system works and why it so imperative that we stand up for what's right. Children do not deserve what is being done to them and as a society we will have to answer for the atrocities being committed as I type. More and more are coming forward, even if not as publicly as myself and the others, but they are trying to speak up as best they can. We are the greatest threat to the gay community, and they are well aware. They admit as much by attacking us with such fervor and heat so publicly.

One of the things I have observed since the SCOTUS ruling is the attitude of many people that supported ssm becoming less. . .supportive. See, the thing is so many people thought that giving in and letting gays have ssm would shut them up and they would go away. Like a little child nags you for something until you finally give in, hoping to just stop the noise. But it didn't work that way in this case. Nope. Once they got it all you saw were articles about where the gay agenda was going next, and how throuples and polyamorous couples want marriage, and now of course all of the trans junk. By the way, I find being referred to as cisgendered very offensive. What the crap people? We're straight. Not cisgendered. There was already a term for us. One had to be created for them.

Once people saw that the gay machine was rolling full steam ahead they felt tricked, beguiled. And the polls show it. The support for ssm is down, but what does it really matter? Too little, too late. My only hope is that people wake up enough to realize that giving them marriage does not mean that we must give them children. For crying out loud, people need to realize what a train wreck this is going to be.

In closing I would just like to say that I've been extremely overwhelmed by the support and words of encouragement I have received from readers. I never imagined my little ol' blog would make it to people all around the world. It's humbling to say the very least. I would love to do a Q&A with any of you that might be interested. What would you like to know about me, the way I was raised, etc? Please leave questions in the comments and I'll throw together a post with answers to the questions I get.

Thank you for reading. Thank you for sharing if you feel so inclined. But most of all, please get involved in the fray in some form or fashion. This is about all of us, and sooner or later this subject is going to touch your life if it hasn't already.

Goodnight from Podunk, Oklahoma, USA

Meet Ron Walker, DEMOCRAT:  Ron Walker, 41, an electrician who lives in a two-story home clad in white siding in Hollis Queens, where a great deal of my relatives live... I might add.  He was delighted to know that he lives in a home built by the Trump clan...... AND  was delighted to learn of his Trump connection. The closest he had come to a Trump affiliation before this, he said, was doing some electrical work at Trump Village, Fred Trump's middle-income housing development in Coney Island, Brooklyn.

It was "just awesome," he said of his link to his preferred presidential candidate, "a very smart man" who "knows business and knows how to run things."

Mr. Walker said he was a registered Democrat, but would be willing to SWITCH parties to vote for Donald J. Trump. "You know the looks I get when I'm wearing this?" he said, flourishing a "Trump 2016" T-shirt.

Today in History:  Marks the Birth of al Qaeda

Al  Qaeda, Arabic for "the base," is an international terrorist network.   Its main goal is to rid Muslim countries of what it sees as the direct influence of the West, and replace it with fundamentalist Islamic regimes. Attacking outside of Muslim countries in acts of violence is directed by high-ranking members of that extremist group.  Unlike what we believe to be true, there is no "supreme leader", president nor central "king-pin", when one "leader" is killed, another takes his place ---- a temporary position at best.

Here are some excerpts from their manual or a small section from an al Qaeda handbook recovered by police from a terrorist's home in Manchester, England.

In the name of Allah, the merciful and compassionate. The main mission for which the military organization is responsible is the overthrow of the godless regimes and their replacement with Islamic regimes. Other missions consist of the following:

>Gathering information about the enemy, the land, the installations, and the neighbors.

>Kidnapping enemy personnel, documents, secrets, and arms.

>Assassinating enemy personnel as well as foreign tourists.

>Freeing the brothers who are captured by the enemy.

>Spreading rumors and writing statements that instigate people against the enemy.

>Blasting and destroying the places of amusement, immorality, and sin.

Good Wednesday Morning!

In Cold Blood......

Twenty Nine year old Bryant Brewer of Chicago surprised the 43-year-old Officer Soderberg .  Soderberg  was approached by Bryant Brewer, 24, and a physical altercation ensued.  During the struggle, Brewer was able to disarm and fatally shoot Officer Soderberg.  Then, Brewer stole his gun and left the officer to die.  Moments later, Brewer opened fire in what appears to have been an attempted-armed robbery of a civilian.  Officers heard the gunshots and ran out of the building where they discovered Brewer and exchanged gunfire with him.  Brewer was wounded, but recovered.  Officer Thor Soderberg died at the scene.

According to the latest victimization paradigm, Officer Soderberg was probably brutalizing Black men in his spare time both on the job and off......  Right?  Well, no......On July 7, 2010 (the day of his death), Officer Soderberg participated in a weeklong police operation called Operation Protect Youth.  The program was taking place in the Target Response Unit's facility located at 6120 S. Racine Ave — former Englewood District Station.  At approximately 3:45 p.m., Officer Soderberg, a US Army veteran, finished his shift and proceeded to walk to his vehicle in the deployment's parking lot, that was when he met Bryant Brewer.
He was attacked and murdered in cold blood.

Thor Soderberg was honored by the addition of his star to the Police Superintendent's Honored Star Case at the Chicago Police Headquarters.

 His is the 479th Honored Star. 

What about Brewer?  Well........Neither side disputes that Brewer shot Soderberg three times before firing at several other officers and one civilian outside a police deployment center in the Englewood neighborhood.  You see it takes three bullet holes in the body of a policeman for it to be undisputed that the criminal fired at least three times.....

The fact that Brewer (the killer) was inattentive, spoke in gibberish, and appeared disoriented and sometimes hostile during four interviews with him, was cause to make sure that he was not insane or at least mentally impaired......  this task took the work of several psychiatrists, tests and the like conducted over the past several years or so....  I guess we always need to find out the motives of killers, especially when they pump bullets into a policeman..... you see, the killer might be suffering from a bad childhood, maybe his parents did not read to him from the Berenstain Bears collection, maybe he did not get the toy he wanted for Christmas when he was 6 or maybe he was mad about White Supremacy.... 

Mr. Brewer was given quite attentive care by two well thought of psychiatrists and a very sensitive defense lawyer.  He was even thought to be schizophrenic, they pondered his motives......  could it have been the Heineken beer that the Officer Soderberg  was anticipating having ......  it was apparently in his car .... perhaps for future consumption in front of the television later....?  

Geeze, what could it be?  Maybe Mr. Brewer got scared after shooting one shot and then his trigger finger was shaking so hard that the gun "went off" two more times!!!!!!!!  

Or just maybe "Mr. Brewer" is a common liar, street thug and general killer who knew how to play the system of bleeding heart, compassionate Caucasians who are afraid of being called "names".  Perhaps they overlooked the testimony of Brewer's former housemate Vernon Brown, who testified Brewer talked several times about how much he hated police and wanted to kill them.  Maybe he was just a violent, evil person who would have killed both psychiatrists if he had access to THEIR weapon.  

He was smirking when, after hours of awaiting a verdict, the judge came back convicting Brewer of one count of attempted first-degree murder, one count of armed robbery and one count of murder in the first degree.  Sentencing next month.

It only took 6 years.

status_message:
Today in History:  1944 Anne Frank was  captured

Acting on tip from a Dutch informer, the Nazi Gestapo captures 15-year-old Jewish diarist Anne Frank and her family in a sealed-off area of an Amsterdam warehouse. The Franks had taken shelter there in 1942 out of fear of deportation to a Nazi concentration camp. They occupied the small space with another Jewish family and a single Jewish man, and were aided by Christian friends, who brought them food and supplies. Anne spent much of her time in the "secret annex" working on her diary. The diary survived the war, overlooked by the Gestapo that discovered the hiding place, but Anne and nearly all of the others perished in the Nazi death camps.

Annelies Marie Frank was born in Frankfurt am Main, Germany, on June 12, 1929. She was the second daughter of Otto Frank and Edith Frank-Hollander, both of Jewish families that had lived in Germany for centuries. With the rise of Nazi leader Adolf Hitler in 1933, Otto moved his family to Amsterdam to escape the escalating Nazi persecution of Jews. In Holland, he ran a successful spice and jam business. Anne attended a Montessori school with other middle-class Dutch children, but with the German invasion of the Netherlands in 1940 she was forced to transfer to a Jewish school. In 1942, Otto began arranging a hiding place in an annex of his warehouse on the Prinsengracht Canal in Amsterdam.

On her 13th birthday in 1942, Anne began a diary relating her everyday experiences, her relationship with her family and friends, and observations about the increasingly dangerous world around her. Less than a month later, Anne's older sister, Margot, received a call-up notice to report to a Nazi "work camp." Fearing deportation to a Nazi concentration camp, the Frank family took shelter in the secret annex the next day. One week later, they were joined by Otto Frank's business partner and his family. In November, a Jewish dentist—the eighth occupant of the hiding place—joined the group.

For two years, Anne kept a diary about her life in hiding that is marked with poignancy, humor, and insight. The entrance to the secret annex was hidden by a hinged bookcase, and former employees of Otto and other Dutch friends delivered them food and supplies procured at high risk. Anne and the others lived in rooms with blacked-out windows, and never flushed the toilet during the day out of fear that their presence would be detected. In June 1944, Anne's spirits were raised by the Allied landing at Normandy, and she was hopeful that the long-awaited liberation of Holland would soon begin.

On August 1, 1944, Anne made her last entry in her diary. Three days later, 25 months of seclusion ended with the arrival of the Nazi Gestapo. Anne and the others had been given away by an unknown informer, and they were arrested along with two of the Christians who had helped shelter them. They were sent to a concentration camp in Holland, and in September Anne and most of the others were shipped to the Auschwitz death camp in Poland. In the fall of 1944, with the Soviet liberation of Poland underway, Anne was moved with her sister Margot to the Bergen-Belsen concentration camp in Germany. Suffering under the deplorable conditions of the camp, the two sisters caught typhus and died in early March 1945. The camp was liberated by the British less than two months later.

Otto Frank was the only one of the 10 to survive the Nazi death camps. After the war, he returned to Amsterdam via Russia, and was reunited with Miep Gies, one of his former employees who had helped shelter him. She handed him Anne's diary, which she had found undisturbed after the Nazi raid. In 1947, Anne's diary was published by Otto in its original Dutch as Diary of a Young Girl. An instant best-seller and eventually translated into more than 50 languages, The Diary of Anne Frank has served as a literary testament to the nearly six million Jews, including Anne herself, who were silenced in the Holocaust.

The Frank family's hideaway at Prinsengracht 263 in Amsterdam opened as a museum in 1960. A new English translation of Anne's diary in 1995 restored material that had been edited out of the original version, making the work nearly a third longer.

status_message:
Good Tuesday Evening!

The Videos, Planned Parenthood and the Myth of 3%

Many have been riveted by the revelations by videos – now 5, regarding Planned Parenthood and the reported "harvesting" of human organs. Money changes hands in this level of commerce but there is currently a dispute as to whether or not the organs (livers, and such) are actually sold for profit (presumably it is illegal to profiteer in human body parts) or as "reimbursement" for "expenses".

The "reimbursement" paradigm is more palatable for some people than than the possibility of doctors without conscience making plans for the new wing on their home, family travel or perhaps a Lamborghini. The "reimbursement" paradigm also provides us the necessary cover for feelings of guilt, (for whatever reason) or the comforting knowledge that should the "problem" of an unwanted pregnancy arise , we have the "problem" covered without the pesky feeling that a part of us could be coldly spliced, diced and sold as spare parts for any reason. "Reimbursement" implies a "helping hand" while "profit" an be thought of as something else…. something colder and less humane.

Essentially, Planned Parenthood,is currently embroiled in a scandal over secret videos capturing its dismemberment of unborn babies and sale of their body parts. In addition, although there has been much objection as to the practice of having the prospective mother view an ultrasound of her baby prior to making the decision to abort, no such though is given by the doctors using the ultrasound procedure to make sure that they preserve and not crush those parts of the child that they need for a particular order.

Callously, one doctor after another discusses in casual talk, or over a glass of wine and a bowl of delectable salad greens, the procedure for procuring bits and pieces of organs, the profitability of each organ and how not to make them "crunchy" —- as though they were speaking of frying potato chips. But I have a few questions for this group of modern day body merchants:

1> Planned Parenthood claims that abortions are only 3 percent of what they provide. If the practice of abortion is only 3 percent of what they do, then could they just not get by on the other 97 percent of their business? Or is there something that I am missing in this equation?

Further, is the abortion counted as an abortion by this organization or as just another one of the services that are offered? For example, say you have the abortion, but first another pregnancy test is performed, then afterward you are checked for an STD or two (say two), then you are prescribed medication, and perhaps you obtain two lab tests. Guess what, the abortion only counts for 20 percent or 1/5 of the procedures that you went in for….

From Oct. 1, 2012 to Sept. 30, 2013, Planned Parenthood performed 327,653 abortions out of 1,058,490 performed in total for that period. That is roughly 30%. Planned Parenthood performs approximately 30 percent of all abortions in the United States per year.

2>I watched as Elizabeth Warren, the Superwoman of the left and reportedly of Native Americans, argue that the videos are "fraudulent". I have not been able to understand how one can inveigle a doctor to speak about the profit of "baby livers" and making sure that something is not "crunchy". Is she suggesting that the video technicians used robots or synthesizing machines to change the words in these people's mouths? Or is she appealing to those people who will stick their fingers in their ears, shut their eyes and scream until given direction, no matter how nonsensical or improbable from someone who will soothe their mind but never and momentarily numb their soul to such barbaric practices not seen outside of a horror film or reports of the experiments of Josef Mengele. No, Warren's argument was about as thin as her claim that she is a Cherokee Indian tribe member.

3>What does it take to get doctors to the level of callousness about human life that they readily sell the remains of otherwise healthy humans? I watch younger women with the knowledge that technology did not create the ghoulish words and phrases that emanated from the mouths of politicians twist and turn to justify the trafficking of human body parts and I marvel that the human condition has not changed a bit. There is truly nothing new under the sun……..

When I hear the justification that selling human beings is the right thing to do because they are helping the human race with research etc…… I recall that every evil was justified at one time in our history as a necessary "right". For example, slavery , Jim Crow, misogyny, female gentile mutilation and just about any practice of brutality or evil can be explained away, rationalized and justified as right for humanity because of the god given quality of man's intellect to reason and justify.

What we have become accustomed to in America is the ability to follow, to act – out, curse people out, give the middle finger and take pills or other things  to dull the banality of their existence……But what is now becoming increasingly rare is the ability to THINK. We cry for "leaders" but we destroy them because we are unable to lead ourselves on our small level and because they encourage us to think of greater things. We no longer believe or read Sacred text because it makes us painfully aware of our shortcomings because it causes us to reflect or think about them.  Thinking might just make us aware of right and wrong ,which for some is quite painful.

So try to think about this, if the destruction of a small helpless and perfect life — because by definition a baby has no sin, becomes an ordinary and normal way of doing things in our lives, how soon will it be that we deem certain individuals not worthy for anything more than the donation of vital organs. How soon til we callously euthanize the sick or elderly because they "have no value" or they have something of value that we want – maybe he has a great eye, or a healthy kidney or liver……. who cares if he is 26…?

If man can think it, he will do it. Dehumanization is just a thought away. And guess what? Since I started this story…….. 7378 babies have been slaughtered providing untold amounts of livers for the doctors at Planned Parenthood.  How's that for 3 percent?

Read more at http://angelagrahamwest.org/the-videos-planned-parenthood-and-the-myth-of-3/

status_message:
Should not have happened.....

Officer Ray Tensing, of the University of Cincinnati police department, shot and killed 43-year-old Sam Dubose during a routine traffic stop July 19 near campus.

A body camera video that the police played for reporters showed Officer Tensing stopped Samuel Dubose for a missing front license plate. Dubose failed to provide a driver's license as Tensing requested then tried to prevent Tensing, who told Dubose to take his seat belt off, from opening the car door.

The car started slowly rolling forward as Tensing reached in and yelled for him to stop. The officer then pulled his gun and fired once, killing Dubose.

The police chief said Officer Tensing was not dragged by the car, as the officer had reported, but instead he fell backwards after shooting Dubose in the head.

Tensing, 25, was fired by the University of Cincinnati after his arrest. He worked there for four years and was also a graduate of the university.

Dubose was engaged to be married this week , was a  43-year old music producer and artist, was the father of 13 children.  Dubose had previously been arrested on drug charges, but was working to turn his life around.

status_message:
Hunting:

Some people will look at the picture today and assume that I am against hunting.  Not true.  By definition, hunting is the practice of killing or trapping any animal, or pursuing it with the intent of doing so. Hunting wildlife or feral animals is most commonly done by humans for food, recreation, or trade. In present-day use, lawful hunting is distinguished from poaching, which is the illegal killing, trapping or capture of the hunted species. The species that are hunted are referred to as game and are usually mammals and birds.

Hunting can also be utilized for modern wildlife management, for example, to help maintain a population of healthy animals within an environment's ecological carrying capacity when natural checks such as predators are absent.

As for game consumption, I have tried it and I respect those who enjoy it but unfortunately for me, I suppose, my palate is not sufficiently sophisticated enough to enjoy it. In fact, I really don't even like poultry, except for the occasional turkey at holidays.  I do, however, certainly respect those who enjoy game meat.  

 Fishing, which is not commonly categorized as a form of hunting. 

What I am talking about in regards to the killing of Cecil is referred to as "Trophy Hunting" or poaching which is illegal.  As some hunters will rightly point out, humans have been taking the lives of animals since the dawn of our existence, and it is, therefore, natural. But paired with that instinct, rooted just as deep, is another quality that's uniquely human: a tendency to feel respect for the things we kill.

It is in our nature to hunt. But there's nothing natural about killing for fun.

For well over a century, trophy hunters from the U.S. and Europe have been shelling out money for the chance to shoot Africa's most iconic wildlife, like lions, elephants, and rhinos, posing proudly next to the corpses.

In the last five decades alone, lions have declined from over 100,000 across the continent to as few as 25,000. Still, trophy hunters kill roughly 600 of these animals every year, compounding lions' other threats, like habitat loss and retaliatory killing by villagers, prompting many conservationists to argue that lions should be listed as an endangered species.

Other endangered animals, such as rhinos and elephants, both popular trophy game, are faring even worse -- with some predicting that the latter could go extinct in a little over a decade.

Hunting or trapping for the purpose of providing meat for consumption or control of an over-run population can be thought of as a form of conservation.  It is impossible as man decides to encroach on the natural habitat of animals in order to build homes, shopping centers, highways, businesses and the ubiquitous parking lots that these animals will not become displaced.  As a result of this displacement, they will continue to multiply and pose a danger for themselves as well as the "people population".

Trophy hunting advocates tout the activity as a key form of conservation -- but in reality, it merely contributes to the gradual decimation of endangered species around the world. Cecil, the 13 year old lion,  was skinned and beheaded (no part of him was eaten), and the hunters tried to destroy the GPS collar that Cecil was wearing as part of research backed by Oxford University.  Thus it was known that this animal was not for the hunt.

And, as for helping the starving, skinny local African towns, very little of the revenue will go to them.  It usually provides wealth for the organizers.  Last year, hunters bid on  the right to hunt an endangered black rhinoceros (Diceros bicornis) in Namibia.  The permit was sold for $350,000, well above the previous high bid for a permit in that country, $223,000. It is quite common for an African nation to sell permits for trophy hunting, even for endangered species. Indeed, both Namibia and South Africa are legally permitted by the Convention on International Trade in Endangered Species (CITES) to sell five permits for the hunting of adult male black rhinos each year.

Trophy hunters do not necessarily want to poach as in the case of the wealthy dentist from the Midwest.   A majority of hunters the researchers in a recent study that they preferred hunting in an area where they knew that a portion of the proceeds went back into local communities. Nearly half of the hunters they interviewed also indicated that they'd be willing to pay an equivalent price for a poorer trophy if it was a problem animal that would have had to be killed anyway.

These hunters, bay and large, also stated that they they were less willing to hunt in areas where wild dogs or cheetahs are illegally shot, in countries that intentionally surpass their quotas, or with operators who practice "put-and-take hunting," which is where trophy animals are released onto a fenced-in property just before a hunt. Together this suggests that hunters were willing to place economic pressure on countries and tour companies to operate in as ethical a manner as possible.

Right or wrong, good or bad...... you decide.  BTW the rhino in the picture below is no longer living.

Good Tuesday Evening!

Ordinary Evil.

The mask of "ordinary" is powerful.  "Ordinary" events occur with regularity, nothing outlandish, nothing to fear.  "Ordinary people" are almost always "well meaning" and generally mindful of societal norms and habits, they conform to what society expects of them.  They do their jobs and are generally given the "benefit of the doubt" whenever there is some conflict or question.  When "ordinary people" do things that are considered "out of the norm", we have a tendency to to second guess what we see or hear, because the "mask" tells us that we can not believe what our "lying eyes" show us to be true.  The mask of "ordinary" can be a powerful tool.

Doing horrendous things in an orderly fashion depends upon the  "normalization." of an act by "ordinary people".  The process of "normalization" allows degrading acts of barbarism and the unspeakable behavior of one man or woman to another to become accepted as "ordinary life" or "ordinary thinking".   The normalization of the vicious and ugly behavior and practices for the behavior to take hold and become acceptable as "the way things are done".  Once this behavior is accepted, it becomes part of what is deemed to be "fair" and any movement against its grain is deemed to be "unfair".

Early in the last century, an "ordinary woman", with "ordinary" looks and even a "motherly countenance" said the following words:  "Birth control must lead ultimately to a cleaner race" and even said, "We should hire three or four colored ministers, preferably with social-service backgrounds, and with engaging personalities. The most successful educational approach to the Negro is through a religious appeal. We don't want the word to go out that we want to exterminate the Negro population, and the minister is the man who can straighten out that idea if it ever occurs to any of their more rebellious members."

"Oh shucks," you might say....."she did not mean THAT" .......  She just wants to "empower women".......  help the Black woman"....... "heck and darn, she was just in-artful in her speech"......  But, with swift and deft precision, the organization that she founded can boast that according to a recent study from The Center for Disease Control 82 Percent of Abortions in New York City and 64% in Texas Were on Black or Hispanic Babies.

Once again, the mask of "ordinary" is powerful.

So..... let's take this a bit further......  Let us get attractive,  accomplished and vocal women to assure us that with the passage of Roe vs. Wade, we will finally achieve "reproductive freedom".  We call it "Freedom of Choice", which sounds like a glorious term and proclaim any person not "with it" to be "out of the ordinary" - you know a "neanderthal".....  The is deemed "reproductive fairness" even though (at the most) only 50% of the equation of an abortion will get a say in the matter.  The other half will, by definition, be "silenced".  

Now, take for example, the "little kerfuffle" with Planned Parenthood.  It appears that the "ordinary looking doctors" have been chopping the "itty bitty" parts and pieces of what could have been a great artist, engineer, doctor, philosopher or maybe just another "ordinary person" into tinier pieces and selling the parts off.... bit by bit.....  From what I have been told, this has become an "ordinary practice"...... very similar to that of a "chop shop".  Those of us who have lived in a major city would know the concept of a "chop shop".  When my first car needed a new part, I went to the "chop shop" to get it.  They have every piece of a car, cataloged piece by piece.......  Some pieces are more expensive than others.  Same theory applied to the little intact baby livers.  Take for example the following scenario:

Holly O'Donnell, a licensed phlebotomist , took a job at Planned Parenthood thinking that her job was going to be just drawing blood, not procuring tissue from aborted fetuses," says O'Donnell, who fainted in shock on her first day of work in a Planned Parenthood clinic when suddenly asked to dissect a freshly-aborted fetus during her on-the-job training.

Her role soon expanded with her ability to scope out the room of sad pregnant souls in search of those who met criteria for fetal tissue orders and to harvest the fetal body parts after their abortions.  Her job became as "ordinary" as the burger maker at Burger King ensuring that the the customer was able to "have it their way".  ---- without the "jingle "of course.

The final part of the "Danse Macabre" of "ordinariness" is to convince the best and the brightest among us that they are doing a higher and nobler  (ad certainly more lucrative) level of work or maybe they have become so numb to the horror of their actions because of their training  and what they see.  Or maybe it is just the dehumanization of the "lump of tissue" that forms when the sperm fertilizes the egg..... that they treat the bits and pieces of humanity as parcels for sale.  Ordinary looking Deborah Nucatola, describes in the first video of this madness,  how Planned Parenthood sells the body parts of aborted unborn children and admitting she uses partial-birth abortions to supply intact body parts.All while stuffing her round face with salad and guzzling red wine.  

Dr. Maru Gatter, in the second video , tells a biotech company officials that the prices for such things as a baby's liver, head or heart are negotiable then jokes about selling enough to place her pale, bloodless body in a new Lamborghini.  Now with the third video, we are treated with Dr. Savita Ginde. at one of the largest and wealthiest Planned Parenthood affiliates which operates abortion clinics and abortion referral centers in Colorado, New Mexico, Wyoming, and Nevada ---- (I just bet he can procure plenty of those "baby livers")

Well it seems that he, while standing in the Planned Parenthood abortion clinic pathology laboratory, where the bodies of babies are brought after abortions, he concludes that payment per organ removed from an aborted baby will be the most beneficial to Planned Parenthood: "I think a per-item thing works a little better, just because we can see how much we can get out of it."

Just like a "chop shop" piece by piece, car parts and now babies.  With the only exception "The sale or purchase of human fetal tissue is a federal felony punishable by up to 10 years in prison or a fine of up to $500,000 (42 U.S.C. 289g-2), though the law is riddled with loopholes that essentially allow such sales."

I am not sure that it will only take three videos to take the "ordinary" out of chopping human beings up and selling the parts.  Even when as Dr. Maru Gatter pointed out that she wanted to avoid the "crunchy parts"  (does she munch on the crunchy at the movies?)- ........  by the way, why does that not evoke the feeling to vomit?  Because it is part of "normal and ordinary".  Normal for the U.S. and for Canada, and Russia..... not so much in the rest of the world.  The idea of abortion up to the point of "almost birth" is something that most of the rest of the world would not view as an ordinary, ho-hum and business as usual.  

It appears that what money and power demand, science and technology will provide, however outrageous the end.  It is said that youth is wasted on the young.  As he ages, a man begins to realize his mortality and the need to prolong his presence on this earth.  The horror of what it takes to procure this false immortality, necessitates the normalization of this aforementioned  practice.  Just as slavery, misogyny, female genital mutilation, and other human constructs are explained away in the context of "fairness"  or the "ordinary" ....... so will the Godless abuses by Planned Parenthood.

Eventually, harvesting body parts of the unfortunate will become the "ordinary" way of life in America........The mask of "ordinary" is powerful. Because .......all of this can't be as bad as our "lying ears and eyes" say it is.........

Or is it?  "The sad truth is that most evil is done by people who never make up their minds to be good or evil." 
― Hannah Arendt

Will We Ever Stand Up For What is Right Again?

Trump is surging in the polls.  He speaks his mind, regardless of the circumstance or the "blow-back" and he resonates with the people.  Do you agree with everything he says? Well, no one can agree all of the time, but he is a man who is not timid.  As the media circles and attacks, the public pays attention and moves to his side as the distrust of the media is at an all time high.  As the other candidates unwisely come forth one after the other making ridiculous demands that he "drop out of the race", the public realizes that this might amount to a plate of "sour grapes" since the losing Little League team might also want the winning team to "drop out".  As the Macy's or whatever store risks their already flagging foot traffic by joining with other corporate bullies to pressure him because they want to maintain the cheap labor that they glean from the illegal immigrants. the public perceives that this man ,Trump, is willing to put his money where his mouth is and they remain impressed.   Why is this happening?  Because at the very core, people understand the gross misbehavior, baffling values, violations of the constitution and racial animus promulgated over the past few years is part of the fundamental change that was promised.  They know that until one of the richest, brashest, and most unafraid men that they know spoke up, they felt collectively neutered.   He stands up, when they can't or won't.  So I ask....... will America ever stand up for what is right again when so much is wrong?  Let me give you some examples:

1.  The Charleston shooter was a 21 year old white male with very little education, a drug problem, and apparently some type of mental disorder.  In his "manifesto" he discusses the fact that he was unable to find many like minded people (KKK or Skinheads) in his native South Carolina so he reached out over the internet, developed some supremacy ideas, went into a famous African American church and committed a horrific crime of murder. A Presidential statement came soon afterwards and  he went to Charleston and delivered the eulogy at the funeral for the Reverend Clementa Pinckney.  A 24-year-old Muhammad Youssef Abdulazeez., a Kuwaiti who has traveled back and forth to the Middle East shoots and kills 4 Marine recruiters and soon after a sailor dies and one other is still trying to recover....  The response from the president?  He responds that it is  "heartbreaking" in a speech making sure that you were told the shooter was a "lone wolf"  even though he said that not much was known about the situation.  This was prior to vacationing in New York with his daughters and friends for the weekend.  Suffice to say he won't be singing Amazing Grace at these funerals.... it's politics all the time, all day, everyday.

2.  Soon after the shooting in Chattanooga, the media made the call that the shooter was a "white male".  After finding out that few "white males" have the name of Muhammad, the collective disappointment made them immediately proclaim that he was a "lone wolf", even after finding out about his trips to Kuwait, his manifesto, and statements.  We were to feel sorry for him and realize that he was an all America apple pie boy who was fired from his job which caused him to develop mental problems and use drugs - as if the average American boy has a father who was once on the terrorist watch list.  In other words, THE man made him do it.  Contrast, the 21 year old Dylan Roof was turned into the Grand Dragon of the KKK/Skinhead   Charleston chapter of 1.  Hundreds of Black people killed  each other last month in Chicago, Detroit, New York but this crazy young man becomes the catalyst for burning flags, fighting in the streets, gang beating a white man, the suggestion of a Mayor of a blighted community to dig up the bones of a confederate soldier from the local park, defacing historical monuments and a politician who is a descendant of the Confederacy providing an impassioned, embarrassingly self flagellating speech to tear down the flag.  Meanwhile, a young Black man shoots another in a major city.

3.  The Pentagon said the day after the attack it would continue to leave recruiters unarmed and unprotected, and ordered Marine recruiters to not wear their uniforms to work.  The Army tells the recruiters to "pull the window blinds".  One reporter was incensed because the investigators found a handgun inside the recruiter's office.  They got caught up in the fact that it is not allowed - to carry a gun to protect yourself if you are in uniform......  pulling the blinds at the window should suffice.

4. A Planned Parenthood doctor discusses methods of slicing the needed parts from aborted babies, crushing heads  and selling them.  She does this while enjoying a sumptuous green salad and guzzling red wine.  Planned Parenthood is the organization that honored President Obama in 2013.  He, in turn, ended his address to the largest abortion provider and now body part harvester and sales outlet,  in the U.S., by saying, "God bless you."   Since when did God Bless the murder of innocents?  One doctor in a subsequent video suggested she would sell enough to buy a luxury sports-car.  No matter how much you go to church, no matter how deep your faith..... your tax dollars provide the scalpel that cuts the liver out of the back of a sweet baby.  By the way both of the doctors are still working for the organization.

5.  Yesterday I listened to a very conservative station taking calls from veterans regarding the situation with John McCain.  It seems that the collective outrage regarding Trump making comments about not being a fan of John McCain is limited to McCain's friends, associates, family, fellow politicians and the media because the overwhelming message from the veterans was that they were one of the "crazies" that liked Donald Trump and he (McCain) was really "not all that".  But they did respect his service.  

This is but 5 examples, however, you get the picture.  A great deal of the voting public are confronted with these situations and more each day.  They realize the problems and are not buying what the politicians are selling. AND, the continued attacks on Trump may not get him to the White House, but it could "deep six" any hope that the huge mass of career politicians running against Trump will prevail against the Democratic challenger.  The media is just not  understanding that the people no longer care about the red and blue game........   They will not run in horror to the refuge of Jeb Bush....... as is being reported.   Common core, immigration amnesty, and tax reforms mean nothing to them as their basic needs for common decency is challenged on a daily basis ...... the public is neither interested nor engaged.   A hungry man is an angry man  and the average American is hungry for leadership, not politics as usual.  

The Trump feeling ain't going away any time soon.  He is now at 24 percent.

Good Friday Morning!

The Press says:  "The Shooter was a White Male"

I was at a luncheon yesterday in Dallas.  Allen was the speaker and the first part of the focus was on domestic issues, the last part was about problems on the international front, in specific Iran, ISIS/ISIL and threats.  Could an attack happen here?  What is the command climate in the military?

Unknown to us at the time, these questions were very prophetic, since by the time we got to the car and tried to check our cell phones, my iPad had a notice that there were 4 Marines down at a recruiting station in Chattanooga, Tennessee.  We turned on the news in the car and the horror started to stream in.  No names were mentioned but more than one broadcasters described the shooter as a "white male".  Of course we know that piece was not true, but how "interesting", to say the least.

According to Reuters on March 21, 2015, Islamic State posted online what it says are the names, U.S. addresses and photos of 100 American military service members, and called upon its "brothers residing in America" to kill them.

The Pentagon said after the information was posted on the Internet that it was investigating the matter. "I can't confirm the validity of the information, but we are looking into it," a U.S. defense official, speaking on condition of anonymity, said.

So the call was out.... slaughter American military.  So was denial..... they can't confirm the validity.  So months pass, nothing happens on the 4th of July, ..... the "J.V. Squad" does not strike, so we are "home free".  The "myth" of "Islamic Extremism" is a "Right Wing Conspiracy".  Right....Wrong.

A gunman unleashed a barrage of gunfire at two military facilities Thursday in Tennessee, killing four Marines and wounding two other service members and a police officer, officials told CBS News.

The shooter also was killed. Law enforcement sources told CBS News that the shooting suspect was identified as 24-year-old Muhammad Youssef Abdulazeez. 

So he was not a "white male", after-all.......  and there are a couple  more items .......

1.  It appears that the 24 year old Muhammad Youssef Abdulazeez started saying rater prophetic things even when in high school.  "My name causes national security alerts. What does yours do?"Are these the words of an ordinary 18 year old high school graduate?  How chilling could it be to realize that for several years the animus towards Americans boiled just beneath the surface? 

2.  It also is important to note that at some point "lone wolves" become packs of wolves.  What is wrong with people recognizing that bad things such as "sleeper cells" exist in our society and people do mean harm?  The family lived in a solid,picturesque neighborhood.  Abdulazeez was a starter for the varsity wrestling team at Red Bank High School,  he liked beer and played football while his former MMA coach Scott Schrader told CNN: 'He was the All-American kid'. His sisters babysat for neighbors and one was supposedly an excellent 4th grade teacher before recently leaving the position abruptly.

His father was appointed as a 'special policeman' for local public works in 2005, but it has been revealed he was investigated several years ago because of possible links to terrorism.  

Who could tell?

But the narrative that the "shooter was a white male", was perhaps just "wishful thinking" on the part of the press.

status_message:
Planned Parenthood's Butchers

Hannibal Lecter ain't got nothing on the profit-maximizing abortion ghoul caught on tape hawking aborted baby parts as she swilled wine and nibbled on a gourmet salad.
In newly released undercover footage from the pro-life Center for Medical Progress, seasoned abortionist Dr. Deborah Nucatola, who serves as national senior director of "medical services" at Planned Parenthood, chitter-chattered eagerly about fulfilling the bloodthirsty demand for "intact hearts," "lower extremities" and lungs.
Price tag? "You know, I would throw a number out," she babbled breezily as she twirled her fork. "I would say it's probably anywhere from $30 to $100" per specimen.
Hollywood couldn't conjure monsters this chillingly, banally evil.
Nucatola exulted at how fetal livers have become tres chic: "A LOT of people" want them.
She then spoke of the new hot trends in body-parts trafficking as if she were raving about the latest craze for crop tops or artisanal cheese.
"I was like wow," she gushed to her potential clients about the market for unborn baby hearts, "I didn't even know!"
Like wow.
This master of murderous euphemism repeatedly referred to an unborn baby's head as a "calvarium" and casually described the tricks and techniques she and her fellow abortionists use to "increase your chance of success." Rotating the babies so they are delivered breech before being mutilated and slaughtered by the practitioners of Planned Butcherhood works fabulously, in case you were wondering.
Pausing only to swig more luxury libations from her jumbo wine glass, the loquacious death doc explained to investigators posing as fetal tissue company executives how her "providers" use "ultrasound guidance" to target the coveted body parts -- "so they'll know where they're putting their forceps."
In a singsong recitation, this lettuce-chomping Mengele in a silk tank top detailed how the "providers" use ultrasound to become "cognizant of where you put your graspers."
This method is not employed to reduce the pain and suffering of unborn baby and mother, mind you. It's to get "good at getting heart, lung, liver, because we know that -- so I'm not gonna crush that part. I'm going to basically crush below, I'm gonna crush above, and I'm gonna see if I can get it all intact."
Think about that. Planned Parenthood has officially declared it "torture" for women to see their unborn children through ultrasound before submitting to abortion. The billion-dollar abortion industry has lobbied vociferously against increasing ultrasound access to pregnant women on the fence about abortion.
But when the same imaging technology is used to help Planned Butcherhood's "providers" place their forceps strategically to protect their precious organ commodities, it's invaluable "guidance."
Now you know if you didn't already or if you were in abject denial. Planned Parenthood's fetish for late-term abortion stems not from compassion for mothers, but from the cold-blooded drive to drum up cold, hard cash. The practice has continued for at least 15 years, when Planned Parenthood's human harvesters in Kansas were first uncovered.
Can it get any more stomach-turning? Brace yourselves. This video is just the first in a series by the Center for Medical Progress, which has been investigating Planned Butcherhood's illegal, immoral trafficking of aborted fetal parts for almost three years.
The expose comes after years of undercover journalistic work by Lila Grace Rose and Live Action, who have caught government-supported Planned Parenthood officials covering up for sexual predators, promoting gendercide, flouting health regulations and disclosure laws, soliciting money from racist eugenics zealots who want more black babies aborted, and perpetuating a homicidal racket in the name of "reproductive health."
Nucatola is no rogue underling. She's Planned Parenthood's "senior director" of "medical services" with years of scalpel-wielding, hands-on abortion training. She bragged not only about her own expertise in procurement of baby body parts, but about the everyday trafficking that goes on "behind closed doors" at countless "affiliates."
When you've recovered from your nausea, ask yourselves this: What kind of country do we live in where law-abiding businesses are fined, threatened and demonized for refusing to bake gay wedding cakes, but barbaric baby butchers are hailed by feminists, Hollywood and a president who asked God to "bless" them?
God help us.
Michelle Malkin is author of the new book "Who Built That: Awe-Inspiring Stories of American Tinkerpreneurs." Her email address is malkinblog@gmail.com.

status_message:
Today in history:

On July 16, 1936, photographer Walker Evans (1903-75) took a leave of absence from the Farm Security Administration (FSA) to accept a summer assignment with Fortune magazine. Evans, who had begun working as a photographer in 1928, had developed a modest reputation by the time that he was hired in October 1935 by Roy Stryker, then leader of the FSA photographic section. Stryker agreed to grant him leave for the magazine assignment on the condition that his photographs remained government property.

Evans and the writer James Agee spent several weeks among sharecropper families in Hale County, Alabama. The article they produced documented in words and images the lives of poor Southern farmers afflicted by the Great Depression; their work, however, did not meet Fortune's expectations and was rejected for publication.

Evans' desire to produce photographs that were "pure record not propaganda" did not harmonize with Stryker's emphasis on the use of the image to promote social activism. Soon after the Alabama series was completed, Evans returned to New York. There Evans and Agee reworked their material and searched for another publisher. In 1941, the expanded version of their story was published in book form as Let Us Now Praise Famous Men, now recognized as a masterpiece of the art of photojournalism.
Walker Evans went on to exhibit and publish his work (he was a staff photographer at Fortune, 1945-65) and to teach at the Yale University School of Art and Architecture. James Agee became one of America's most influential film critics as well as a poet, novelist, and screenwriter. James Agee died in 1955; Walker Evans died in 1975. Today in History.com

For many with sons, the thought of a party involving too much to drink and an amorous encounter with a young woman might grip you with fear given the fact that the intensified crackdown on campus sexual assault over the last few years has at times skewed too far against those accused.

On the basis of just the word of the accuser, the fellow might be accused of something that would put him in prison or having to register as a sex offender.  We have witnessed false stories in the past year, justified by the media as "well it is occurring you know" and somehow indicating that the innocent should have to pay for all of the other guy's wrong-doings..... if he is indeed innocent.

Is "White Face" Racist?

Police seek bank robber who used lotion as a disguise
BRENDAN GIBBONSPublished: July 14, 2015

A man who smeared white lotion on his face to disguise his appearance robbed a West Scranton bank Tuesday afternoon, Scranton police said.

The man walked into the PNC Bank branch office at 136 S. Main Ave. around 2 p.m. and demanded money, Chief Carl Graziano said.

Witnesses described him as a black man with white lotion on his face, 6 feet 2 inches tall, thin build, wearing light blue pants, a blue long-sleeve shirt and a bucket hat, he said.

Though he threatened employees with a weapon, he did not display it, the chief said.

He took an undisclosed amount of money from the teller, then headed south on South Hyde Park Avenue in an older model red Cadillac, possibly an Eldorado.

Late Tuesday, PNC officials could not comment on the robbery.

Anyone with information should call Scranton police at 570-348-4134.

Good Wednesday Morning!

The "It" Girl 

"Ladies, we have work to do and the time is now."  These words ended her speech to the NAACP.   

But from the beginning, Marilyn Mosby knew that this was her moment, as much as she told the crowd when indicting the 6 officers in the death of Freddie Gray:  "To the youth of this city, I will seek justice on your behalf. This is a moment. This is your moment," 

She told her personal story, inspiring the crowd to understand and appreciate the "hardships" she experienced as she rose to the position she now holds as she stood speaking to the crowd at the NAACP.  At 35, she is the youngest chief prosecutor in any major American city. 

She shared personal struggles including the loss of a beloved cousin when she was 14 that she said helped her turn her pain into her passion to reform the criminal justice system. She the pain she experienced when she was wait-listed at every law school she'd applied to because of very low LSAT scores and then failed the bar exam the first time she took it. She described how others had doubted her, sometimes causing her to doubt herself.

She outlined her election to the position she holds:

 "For me, as a young black woman, to run against an older white male incumbent, powerful, with the ability to raise close to a million dollars, the skeptics wanted to know: How could I have the audacity?"

She told of threats:

"I was told I was too inexperienced, that I couldn't raise enough money, that my decision to run could not only disrupt but potentially destroy my husband's political career,"

She is married to Nick Mosby, a Baltimore city councilman. They have been married since 2005. They have two daughters. They live in the Reservoir Hill neighborhood of Baltimore.

So she persevered..... and was thrust into the national spotlight in April after 25-year-old Freddie Gray was arrested and suffered a spinal injury while being transported in a police van. He died a week later.

"Law enforcement is pretty much instilled within my being," Mosby told MSNBC's Chris Hayes on May 1, the day she publicly announced charges against the officers. "I come from five generations of police officers," she added, pointing out that her mother, father, grandfather and uncles have all served as cops.

We were all impressed with this account because she knew that in making it she implied "who me?  despite the strange and theatrical rhetoric...... I can't possibly have a personal problem with cops.......  my folks were/are all cops!"

She left out a few details, however:

>Mosby's mother, Linda Thompson, first violated the Boston police department's substance abuse policy in 2006. After serving a 45-day rehab stint, Thompson violated the drug code again and voluntarily resigned on Feb. 1, 2008, rather than be fired.  Thompson, now 52, to draw a $1,810.69 monthly pension.  Colleagues say "she was always "high".  She also drew raised eyebrows after the acquittal of OJ for the murder of his wife and friend when she ( Linda Thompson) jumped up on the desk of another officer and began "doing a victory dance." 

Read more: http://dailycaller.com/2015/07/13/bad-blood-marilyn-mosbys-mom-resigned-boston-police-force-after-failing-drug-test/#ixzz3fxnDc4bF

>Mosby's father was fired from the Boston police department in 1991 following accusations that he and his partner robbed drug dealers at gun point. 

>Mosby's uncle was fired from Boston PD in 2001 after testing positive for cocaine. 

>Her grandfather was a well-respected Boston cop, but he ultimately and unsuccessfully sued the department for racial discrimination in the 1980s.

None of this was mentioned when she indicated:  "You can trust me, I come from a family of cops."

The public got an apparent glimpse of Mosby's sentiment towards the cops when she "favorited" two controversial tweets on May 6. One tweet called the officers "thugs" and another asserted that the young prosecutor "INFURIATES a certain kind of white person." Mosby denied favoriting the tweets, saying that her account was hacked. However, her personal account showed no other evidence of being infiltrated.

Read more: http://dailycaller.com/2015/07/13/bad-blood-marilyn-mosbys-mom-resigned-boston-police-force-after-failing-drug-test/#ixzz3fxmxXADK

The Mosbys (Nick and Marylynn) have been featured prominently at some public events since Marilyn Mosby gained national attention May 1 after charging six officers involved in the arrest of Freddie Gray, the 25-year-old whose death in police custody sparked rioting in Baltimore. They couple drew attention when they attended a Prince benefit concert in Baltimore, and the two served as honorary ringmasters at the UniverSoul Circus at Security Square Mall.

Dancing with Prince, ringmasters in a circus, posing for fashion magazines....... all benefit of a flimsy case which will destroy the lives and livelihood of 6 police officers. Days before that speech and subsequent charges— and before the medical examiner's office had even determined Gray's cause of death — she told a group of local clergy members that she was going to seek justice for Gray "by any and all means necessary."

In 2015, Mosby charged six police officers, who arrested Freddie Gray prior to his death, with a variety of crimes including second-degree murder and involuntary manslaughter. Mosby has been criticized for ordering the increased police presence, in the same neighbhorhood that Gray was arrested, just weeks prior to the incident that occurred. Anonymous sources have been reported by CNN as saying the Baltimore police's investigation does not support some of the charges brought against the officers.

Mosby has repeatedly declined to discuss her evidence against the officers, saying she doesn't want to litigate the case in the media.  

Or maybe because the evidence will not support her case.......  either way, she is enjoying her moment(s) because she certainly is "it".  They had to cancel the fundraiser...... another struggle.

status_message:
Good Monday Morning!

The "Elder-Orphans"

"Forever Young" is a song by Bob Dylan, recorded in California in November 1973, released in January 1974.  it spoke to a generation with the opening lyrics:

"May you build a ladder to the stars 
And climb on every rung
May you stay forever young
Forever young, forever young "

If you graduated from high school that spring of 1974, today you would be 59 years old.  You would be 63 if you were 22 and just graduated from college, either way, you had were our of the "Viet - Nam" era ... essentially.  "Novelist Tom Wolfe coined the term "'Me' decade" in his essay "The 'Me' Decade and the Third Great Awakening", published by New York magazine in August 1976 referring to the 1970s. The term describes a general new attitude of Americans towards atomized individualism. 

Self actualization was the goal of these "Baby Boomers". The Second-Wave Feminist Movement in the United States which began in the 1960s carried over to the 1970s, and took a prominent role within society.  The gay movement made a huge step forward in the 1970s with the election of political figures such as Harvey Milk to public office and the advocating of anti-gay discrimination legislation passed and not passed during the decade. Many celebrities, including Freddie Mercury and Andy Warhol, also "came out" during this decade, bringing gay culture further into the limelight.

African-Americans in the 70s and 80s The 1970s was a decade of progress and achievement for African-Americans. In 1970, the Black population numbered 22.6 million, representing about 11 percent of the total U.S. population and accounting for nearly 90% of all minorities in the U.S. In the decade following the Civil Rights movement, African-Americans fought through barriers in many areas to achieve the equality they rightfully deserved.

In just about every part of society, the 1970's were exciting, full of change and certainly interesting.  Those who were "young" during this decade were certainly "building a ladder to the stars".  And because of this, they thought they would be "Forever Young".

With the advent of the pill, rise of opportunities outside of the  home, and the changing views of society, many of the "Baby Boomers: decided that it was well within their interests to "put off" certain things...... after all, remaining "forever young" means that the need to think about marriage and children can wait..... right?

Wrong...... This generation was one of the first that elected not to have children.

According to U.S. Census data, about one-third of Americans aged 45 to 63 are single, a 50% increase from 1980, and nearly 19% of women aged 40 to 44 have no children, compared to 10% in 1980.  I have more friends who have NO children than have.  Whether it's seeing other women raising kids in unsuccessful relationships, parents who have struggled with difficult children, or seeing women who have lost part of their identity to their children, there are many external reasons that my friends have given for their decision to forgo having children or even being or staying married.

So...... what happens when "that age" comes upon you?  When you no longer get up in the morning feeling that you can "slay the dragons"  or at least run 5 miles before putting in 8 hours at work and then dancing until the wee hours of the morning?  At least I can remember getting off of work at 5:30 in Munich, getting to my flat where all my "roomies" were also declaring that they were too tired to go out and then someone flips on the music........ we would be downtown within the 2 hours and looking fabulous after a 30 minute "power nap" and shower.  I wish we could all be THAT "forever young".

But we can't..... stay forever young......about 60% of nursing home residents do not have regular visitors because they have no "family".

For those who bit the idea of the impending doom from the population explosion of the 1970's, they would be proud to know that  U.S. fertility rates have reached another record low, at 62.5 births per 1,000 women of childbearing age, according to the most recent government figures. 

"Elder orphans." These seniors are single or widowed; they have no children, at least in the area, and no support system. And they find themselves alone with no one to help care for them when they need it. About 22% of Americans 65 years and older are in danger of becoming, or already are, in this situation. As of 2012, there were 43 million people over 65 in the U.S., up from 35 million in 2002.

Many of the people who fall into this sector of society may have had long marriages where they decided not to have children, prepared financially and built up a network of friends, both in their age group and younger, to help them when they need it.   One problem here, friends have families also, unless they too are alone,  who might take priority over YOU.  

This is a population that can utilize expensive healthcare resources because they don't have the ability to access community resources while they're well but alone.  From hospice to in-home services, the healthcare system is based on an assumption that family members will be there to shoulder the majority of care. When no family is available, elder orphans are created.

So why is it important to identify this group?  Primarily because they vote and they have already been identified by those wishing to make sure that Obamacare stays in place, the group that will also seize upon any "bold move" to change "entitlements"..  Running on the issue of "repeal" might not be the ticket....especially with this growing group.   There is little research on how these seniors will affect society and the medical system in the years to come. Hospital social workers and geriatricians already see elder orphans in their work every week. " Elder orphans" are hard on the medical system, since they are often in crisis and need to seek help from costly hospital emergency rooms. 

Having a spouse and children will not necessarily guarantee help and support in your senior years, I am not taking a position on that either way, however, it is one factor to take into consideration when formulating your political decisions. Because:

                       "May your feet always be swift
                        May you have a strong foundation 
                        When the winds of changes shift
                        May your heart always be joyful 
                        And may your song always be sung
                        May you stay forever young"

Are only the lyrics to a song. This group is fearful of change and rightfully so.  Even the women from "Sex in the City" (Carrie, Samantha, Miranda and Charlotte) are now between the ages of 50 and just shy of 60 years old....  it happens....Changes to health care, Medicare, Medicaid, Social Security and other social "cradles" might be a "non-go" here because they are unique in one aspect....... They have few options.  the one emotion that they do have , though, is fear.... and rightfully so.

status_message:
Good Sunday Morning!

Symbolic Acts Defining The New America.

What is a "symbol"?  The meaning "something which stands for something else".  That something can be an art object, a flag, book, people, places or things..... in other words... A symbol can be "profane" or "sacred".  Emile Durkheim was a French sociologist who is credited with the concept of "sacred and profane".  Sacred symbols are those things we set apart as extraordinary, inspiring awe and reverence.  Symbols such as the Bible for Christians, the Torah for Jews or the Qur'an for Muslims are considered "sacred".  The "profane" , however, are those symbols and activities that are routine aspects of our day to day existence.  

Let's discuss for one moment the key word here...... "reverence",  It is often difficult, especially in today's world to "wrap our heads around" something that is "sacred".  Why?  Because to acknowledge something as "sacred" means that we must become "respectful".  Respect is something that is the antithesis of what we want to do in the world that says "if it feels good, do it".  So we attend churches without the "Cross", because this allows the preacher to speak about whatever he "feels" with just some peppering here and there of scripture.  Writers have a tendency to also remove Scripture from the Bible in order to prove a point.  They "adapt" the teachings of whatever passage they want to prove their point.  I often get into discussions with people who start by telling me the chapter and verse of their scripture..... this is called "mystifying" because they are attempting to make you shut up by proving how "holy" they are without actually acknowledging how "holey" their argument was.  

We then wear the cross as a body ornament around our waists, we then attempt to make,( with some success I might add) something that was once considered "sacred", profane.  Here are two other examples:

1>  Marriage:  Marriage is the most basic and significant social relationship to humankind, this was once sacred. This relationship must be nurtured and maintained for the welfare of all. Without marriage, society will fail.  Within the Black community 78 percent or so children grow up without the benefit of a two parent household.  I have mentored many of the girls who have grown up not knowing their fathers and having mothers who are constantly chasing the illusive husband. The cycle starts out simply enough.  The young girl falls "in love", the young man falls "in lust".  She announces "I'm pregnant", he drifts, disappears or simply shows up intermittently throughout before either physically or mentally leaving.  The young girl leaves school.  She then begins another relationship, she gets pregnant again..... and the cycle continues.  I knew of one young woman who told me that between both parents there were 5 "moms and dads" and 18 full and half siblings. She said whenever she got "tired" of one parent "nagging" she would go to another.  On the 18, 4 were in or just out of jail and she was the first to graduate high school.  To a lesser degree this is practiced by different ethnic groups, however, as we move into a "trans-racial" society and people marry across ethnic and economic groups, we will find that the statistics and behaviors will become the same or at least averaged along the spectrum as we are all members of the "human race" after all.

The second issue here is the concept of "state defined" marriage.  As we move towards a "centrally controlled", secular form of America..... to our own detriment...., The state has told us that "marriage" is no longer between a "man and a woman" and that it was never defined that way in the "new" bible.  Well, in direct contradiction to Ephesians 5:25 that instructs "Husbands, love your wives, just as Christ loved the church and gave himself up for her."  The operative words here are "husband" which is "he" and wives , which is "her".  Male and female.  Now, one can argue that "pish, posh".... he really meant that in a "figurative" way..... it could mean "he and he" or "she and she", because Angela....... who are you to say how two people should love one another?  

Quite frankly, I would answer, I am not "in charge of you", and truly I have no opinion about your lives.... I accept people as they are .  But also, I did not write the Book (Bible), I am only a flawed messenger who 4 times a week writes a blog.  In addition, having once lived for two years in a very nice and very gay section of Manhattan, I am not wrapped up in moralizing or self righteous behavior.  I have met many a heterosexual, "church going", "saved, sanctified, and filled with the Holy Ghost", judgmental and hypocritical prudes that I have nothing to do with because of the stingy area of their heart they give to others.    But I ask you, if you re-define marriage, won't you have to do it again and again and again?  In Biblical times, polygamy was common and necessary often because of the mortality rate.   Polygamy is the practice or condition of having more than one  wife, at one time. Polyandry is the practice of one woman taking more than one male as a spouse.  Are we ready for that one?  Or what about the continuous string -- maybe 2 guys and 2 gals, or any other continuous string which will come to resemble a legal orgy.  

Let me make this clear, any man-made law can and will be changed again.  And finally, we don't live forever.  What about the children...........  The media has successfully "shut up and shut out" dissenting voices of the children of same sex unions.  You will find in liberal publications how "happy" and "accomplished" these children are ---- much MORE so that those raised in happy heterosexual unions.  If this were true, then shouldn't we ALL become homosexual because it is so much fun, enjoyable and stylish.... not to mention great for children?  Simple minds read this garbage and believe it........  

>Culture and Decency. As outline earlier this past week, there is a movement to erase history and replace it with some revised version of fantasy and light that will make everyone FEEL good.  Rep. Jenny Horne, R-Summerville, got emotional as she spoke during debate over a Senate bill calling for the Confederate flag to be removed from the Capitol grounds Wednesday, July 8, 2015, in Columbia.  I was embarrassed for her, because although she (Horne) said her powerful words were not planned, the reality was that she was so impassioned with guilt and so mindful that she would be famous for a little while that she sparked a movement to promote mass ignorance.

Historical symbols are just that.  They exist because events in history existed. Now the mayor of Memphis wants to disturb the bones of confederate figures buried beneath a park.  You see to do this would require a backhoe and shovels. To solve the real problems of a predominantly Black city such as Memphis would require real work.  Good or bad, right or wrong, events in history occurred and we study them objectively to make sure that they don't happen again or that we emulate the good things.  Or that we simply learn and meditate.  Are we really prepared to desecrate the memory of the ultimate founding father, George Washington because he had 318 slaves?  

What about Stone Mountain, Georgia? Should we "sand blast this monument where "The largest high relief sculpture in the world, the Confederate Memorial Carving, depicts three Confederate heroes of the Civil War, President Jefferson Davis and Generals Robert E. Lee and Thomas J. "Stonewall" Jackson. The entire carved surface measures three-acres, larger than a football field and Mount Rushmore."  And who should we put it its place? Lucile Ball, Frank Sinatra, the Notorious Biggie, Tu Pac and Jackie "Moms" Mabley?  How "sacred" will that be?

Let me make this clear......Joel A. Rogers noted this phenomenon in his 100 Amazing Facts: "The Negro slave-holders, like the white ones, fought to keep their chattels in the Civil War." Rogers also notes that some black men, including those in New Orleans at the outbreak of the War, "fought to perpetuate slavery."

That's right boys and girls, there were BLACK slaveholders.  John Carruthers Stanly owned three plantations and 163 slaves, and even hired three white overseers to manage his property! He fathered six children with a slave woman named Kitty, and he eventually freed them. William Ellison,  at his death on the eve of the Civil War, Ellison was wealthier than nine out of 10 white people in South Carolina. He owned 900 acres of land and 63 slaves. Not one of his slaves was allowed to purchase his or her own freedom.  Antoine Dubuclet and his wife Claire Pollard owned more than 70 slaves in Iberville Parish when they married.  Hannah Leion owned nine slaves, while the largest slaveholder in 1860 was Ciprien Ricard, who had a sugarcane plantation in Louisiana and owned 152 slaves with her son, Pierre -- many more that the 35 she owned in 1830. Slave-holding was not the "sacred" domain of white people.

Lastly lets talk about decency.  It is now impossible to reprimand any child and especially a child of color in any public school system today.  As they watch their elders scream "racism" even when they are wrong, they learn this behavior and in turn attack their teachers.  Public urination by dirty male hobos in New York will become the anatomy lesson your 12 year old will get as his/her school field trip bus rolls into the "Big Apple" if if Council Speaker Melissa Mark-Viverito gets her way.  In transit hubs, including Penn Station, are plagued by surging numbers of homeless people who publicly masturbate, harass bystanders and demand free food as the city looks the other way.  One can say this is a lesson in life, however, what type of life are you speaking of?  I was sent a picture of people wiping themselves after defecating on the American flag.  

Wake up people, they want not just to defecate on the flag but also to turn your life into that level of excrement. The flag was once "sacred", now rendered "profane" in the most profane of ways.  Begin to care. Our life and the quality thereof is quite "sacred". And our symbols, traditions, manners and decency should be treated as more than "profane".
