status_message:
Good Saturday Afternoon!

"String 'm up"........  The American Sickness.

America, it seems, is being ripped apart piece by piece.  It began as a way to get votes, getting votes means winning elections.  Winning elections means gaining power.  And gaining power is....... the ultimate goal.  Power means riches and grandeur for the "winning team", it means attaining your agenda, it means achieving the utopia your team or you dream of.

So, how do we achieve this political "win"?  Well first we have to define each part of the whole by dividing this "whole" into smaller groups and assigning names and characteristics.  So we divide them (the population) by income (rich, poor or in between); we identify the political groups (Right, Left and Independent); we segregate the age groupings; we identify the gender characteristics; sexual persuasion and then from these larger group divisions, we "micro-target" even further to "fashion" messages that are unique to each and every group........ even if we have to lie because it is just a "white lie"..... and it can't hurt anyone.....  Right?    You decide....

Let's discuss the first division, that of political parties.  George Washington, in his farewell address stated the following:

"However [political parties] may now and then answer popular ends, they are likely in the course of time and things, to become potent engines, by which cunning, ambitious, and unprincipled men will be enabled to subvert the power of the people and to usurp for themselves the reins of government, destroying afterwards the very engines which have lifted them to unjust dominion."

We have witnessed this in our own midst.  One party fighting against the other making untrue statements regarding the history and intent of the other in order to gain power.  The second division is that of race.  Quite frankly, I have never seen race relations so raw and so negative as the past few years.  The Charleston shooter left a "manifesto" as his explanation for the massacre that he was planning.  I read it more than once.  And especially certain sections because my mind just has to satisfy itself with some sort of 'explanation", either sane or insane for anyone committing heinous things.  NO, it does not excuse his behavior, however, the thought of someone killing a vast amount of people after sitting with them in a church without some sort of reasoning.... whether the reasoning is sane or insane., is worse than anything.  It makes this act random.  Random anything random is unsettling, at least for me.  

So, I read his journal.  The first thing I will say is that we are bombarded 24/7 with the Media and Gov't stirring the racial pot.  Everything and anything involves race.  The police are painted as "racist", every social institution is "racist", common expectations of discipline are "racist", school and job tests are "racist", one political party is "racist", one cable station is "racist", certain newspapers are "racist", America is "racist", the prison system is "racist", dolls can be "racist"...... it seems as though race has become the national pastime.

So along comes this really, really deeply disturbed person by the name of Dylann "Storm" Roof.  A young man who did two or three unsuccessful 9th grade stints before dropping out of school to do "God only knows what" while apparently staying "high as a kite".  Here he was under-educated and full of impotent rage, his "journal starts out as such:

"I was not raised in a racist home or environment. Living in the South, almost every White person has a small amount of racial awareness, simply beause [sic] of the numbers of negroes in this part of the country."

I really have not seen nor heard the term "negro" in such a long time, but I digress......  He felt that after reading the Trayvon Martin proceedings that George Zimmerman was correct in what he did.  He then Googled "Black on White Crime" and then apparently was floored by the number of these cases that go unreported in the newspapers.  He then goes on to say that Black people seem to be racially aware from birth, then describing them as  "lower beings" or at least that is how he feels that most white people view Black people.  He also feels that White people are unjustly made to pay for "slavery" even though most of the whites in the South never owned slaves.  He somehow deduces that Blacks were happier under the mantle of slavery since their low intelligence (he misrepresented IQ), impulsive nature  and predisposition towards violence is a result of the massive amounts of testosterone in their loins.  He also did not see the reason that George Washington Carver was so celebrated because he was the "first "n-word" to be able to open a peanut."

Let me make this clear, the image of a "violent" Black man is a powerful tool.  And it is used with frequency.  Twice, my husband ran against a white opponent.  One, tried to paint him as a member of a violent motorcycle gang and the other, with the help of his Dad, created a cartoon of my husband punching out white women.  A local radio host added the "sexual twist."  These are potent images and are used to influence people in the most nefarious manner. We see it and say nothing.   So, some the same people calling for the "stringing and hanging" truly promulgate, promote and believe these images.

Dylann Roof also resented that every history lesson taught to him portrayed white people as bad people or villains.  (For example, Christopher Columbus  who once discovered America is now portrayed as a rapist) He hated what he referred to a "race mixing" and gave the anecdote of a horse and a donkey breeding a mule which is an inferior creature.  Having left school in the 9th grade robbed him of the second Biology class that would have introduced him to DNA.  All humans belong to the same species, so basically all human DNA is the same.

"What is not generally realized is that a huge proportion of people who would generally regard themselves as 'white' have at least one black ancestor in the last four generations (as demonstrated by random sampling of DNA in the population). Being simply 'black' or 'white' is based on only a tiny number of genes concerned with skin color. In most cases, skin color is also linked to a number of other genes which determine other characteristics - blood type, nose shape, etc but these are not fixed just to the skin color genes."

More overall variation could be found, for example, between a white, blond, blue-eyed Icelander and an olive-skinned, brown-eyed Greek both of who would regard themselves as 'white'. "Answer.com

(That Biology 2 class in the 11th grade might have been a key to opening up some enlightenment. )

So..... who cares Angela!!!!! Let's "string him up"!!!!!!  He is a racist!  "Hang him high"This was the hew and cry of every news station this morning.  "Kill him", he is the only one! AND if there is another, then kill him too!  One radio station host said he doesn't even need a trial!  Just shoot him! 

Will we ever ask ourselves the origin of his middle name "Storm" which happens to be part of the name on many of the white supremacy websites?  ......  Nope, the "journalists" just want to string him up and hang him high.

I am grateful for the legal system, which should never be a mob system.  Yes, this man deserves to be punished, but in order to clear up the problem, to cure the "sickness" , we have to realize that this crime, no matter how horrific is simply a symptom of what is happening to our youth.  This "man" is 21 years old.  I have several sweaters that I still wear that are 28 years old and a jacket that is 30.  Some of his pictures show him stomping on the American flag and burning it in one.  Was this not a "challenge" by a Black student, with one lovely young Black girl dancing on the flag for the world to see?   What is happening to make young people hate this country so much?

Our youth and others with not so inquiring minds might digest racial demographic marketing of messages in ways much different than intended.  You see, they are often soooo removed from the concept of political twisting and power that they digest a kernel (often the wrong kernel)  of the information which allows them to take it one step further, and further and further to the point of-madness..... sometimes  Madness that brings us the following statement by Mr. Roof:

".We have no skinheads, no real KKK, no one doing anything but talking on the internet. Well someone has to have the bravery to take it to the real world, and I guess that has to be me."

And we know what happened then.

But not all kids, the teenage children of  Sharonda Singleton, one of nine people shot dead by Dylann Roof, had one statement to give:  'We forgive him'.  And the little children led us in this instance, they are not much younger than the shooter.  Sharonda "did good", God Bless her soul.  

What happens to Dylann Roof is up to the legal system.  What happens to our society is something that the "grown folks' will have to take care of.......... that is after we get over the screeching of "String him up!", "hang him high" and other various and sundry useless phrases.......  The sickness runs deep an this one is uniquely American and only we can cure it.

status_message:
Good Friday Morning!

R-E-S-P-E-C-T

Hate, is a simple four letter word, it suggests passionate dislike and a feeling of enmity towards a person or group of people.  The emotions of "hate" are not present in children when they are born.  It might take years of grooming and experience either dealing with another or being inculcated by the surroundings to reach a level of hate that causes a person to "act out", in simple ways or a more horrific manner.  

Fear, is  a big motivator of hate , love can be as well.  How many times do we have to read that a man or woman loved someone so much that they ended up actually "hating" them...... to death.  

After horrific events, such as in Charleston, there is a rush to "love".  People start singing songs, swaying back and forth, exhorting everyone to "love one another".  A little time passes and then people move on..... why?  Because it is impossible to impress upon large groups of people an exhausting emotion such as  "love".  Biblicaly, we are required to love one another but maybe the Bible is speaking of another type of love ---- respect....  For example, I really, really liked a show that went off the air in January of this year.  The show was called "Parenthood".  Just about every episode involved the emotional and life turmoil of the Braverman family and every episode had one or a few of the children having tears in their eyes over some emotional hurt.  Since everyone has a hurt or pain, if you spread your love and involvement around too thin, you might spend most of your time bawling your eyes out, head-achy and miserable.  I don't believe that God meant for that to be the state of human existence.

So....... instead of the two extreme polar emotions, love and hate, we can choose something in the middle.......  Let's call it "respect".  The definition of "respect" is to feel or show regard for another person.  This is a simple emotion, often lacking in today's environment for  a couple of reasons (among others)  that begin and end with "fear":

>Fear (1).  Internally, we may fear that we are not worthy so w assume those people or that person will "take something away" from us.  For example, the reason that "I have never been able to get this job or that chance in life is because  there is a finite amount of things available and "they" are getting it.  We overlook the idea that those people or that person may have qualities that might render them superior your abilities in one way or another.  We see that in the argument regarding rich and poor.  The feeling is that the rich guy over there took "everything" or was "more fortunate" or somehow managed to "make it off the backs of poor Joe's like me".  Internally, you might acknowledge that they just did more than you did but you loathe to admit it because you "fear" (again) that you have made mistakes.... and a great deal of them.

>Fear (2):  We are taught to fear another group of people.  This can manifest itself in very bad ways.  In the Middle East, the factions - Jews/Muslims/Sunnis/Shia/ etc....... have long standing differences --- religious, territorial and so- on.  These differences will never, ever be resolved because they have become part of a "custom". Things are resolved for a while and then they somehow revert back to the original "beef" that began a couple thousand years ago.  In America, the "fear" that many people have is stoked often by factions, be it political, religious and customary.  And.... once again, we come back to the idea of "territory".  In the news, it is said that the shooter - Dylann Roof was a follower of the 'white supremacy" movement.  After going onto some of these "white supremacy" website, they seem to be quite worried that they might get a "bad reputation" because they just "hate' they don't "kill".  On Clementa Pinckney' s Facebook page, Pioneer Little Europe posted: "Maybe one of my supporters in South Carolina can run for your seat. You don't need it anymore." This was followed by a winking emoticon.  I visited he website called "Stormfront", perhaps because I was curious as to why Dylann Roof had the middle name of "Storm" was it given to him or maybe changed by him.  This is the "mission" statement for this website:

."We are a community of racial realists and idealists. We are White Nationalists who support true diversity and a homeland for all peoples. Thousands of organizations promote the interests, values and heritage of non-White minorities. We promote ours. Yet we are demonized as "racists.""

So........ feeling a bit nervous, I delved a little further.....  and read this:   "hi my name is ghost i'm a mystic i consider myself white under the category of pre-celt graeco-anatolian mesopotamian caucasian. im looking for aryan friends."  

OK, pure nonsense, but I read a little more, and more...... what I found were a collection of domineering leaders and 'misfits".  Many under-educated seeking people who essentially think like they do.  Dylann Roof probably could not find South Africa on a globe, having repeated the ninth grade twice before dropping out and drifting about from one friend's house to another and sleeping in his car in between and spending his days high as a kite when not watching white supremacy videos...... BTW where did he get his collection?  .  This "white ruling" utopia was painted for him as a result of his dysfunctional background..... which we will hear much more of in the coming weeks.  Just as the ISIL or ISIS movement is supposedly recruiting 2000 disenchanted boys and girls from the Western world everyday,  these fringe race groups will also.  And it is not only on the white side, I have listened to Black radio stations which don't do their listeners any favors by constantly looking for examples of "hidden racism" even when a white person hands you a chocolate cookie instead of a vanilla one.    

When you add the internet into the mix, with its ability to anonymously post, vilify and tear down targets, your fear can actually grant "power".  I often watch the media and internet zero in on a target and begin to rip apart this one target with glee.  The anonymous posters sense "blood in the water" and tear apart people limb by limb, dismantling their lives, family and livelihood. The break down their targets for ills that they themselves commit but "fear" drives them to viciously attack in order to mitigate the inward feelings of self loathing.

So, what's the point?  The point is, in the absence of "respect", the outward manifestation of violence, savagery and madness will continue.  Respect for the achievements, struggles and pain for our fellow "traveler" through this life might be just the "love" we need and probably even better.

status_message:
Good Thursday Afternoon!

A Dilemma of Conscience....

This afternoon I listened to President Obama speak about the terrible tragedy at the church in Charleston, South Carolina.  Two things became clear to me:

1.  It is not right or just to use a tragic occasion to push a political agenda.  Case in pint:

"We don't have all the facts, but we do know that once again, innocent people were killed in part because someone who wanted to inflict harm had no trouble getting their hand on a gun."

Given the fact that we now know that the boy's father bought him the gun, what is the President proposing.......  That we completely outlaw gun ownership and confiscate all guns?  The laws regarding mental health and criminal background checks would not have changed this situation at all, nor would it have affected the outcome of the shooting in Connecticut since the reality is that Adam Lanza's mother purchased that gun as well.  If what is being advocated is the complete disarming of American citizens, then the only people who will have guns are criminals and those with nefarious intentions since they are unlikely to ask or care about the legality of gun ownership.   

2.  There is a rush to impose a racial component to this case.  Prior to even knowing anything about this case the invocation of "hate crime" and "racial overtones" were put forward as a motive.  The President said:

"The good news is I am confident that the outpouring of unity and strength and fellowship and love across Charleston today, from all races, from all faiths, from all places of worship, indicates the degree to which those old vestiges of hatred can be overcome.

That certainly was Dr. King's hope just over 50 years ago after four little girls were killed in a bombing at a black church in Birmingham, Alabama."

I took a look at this young man's Facebook page, he had as many black friends and white friends.  This boy appeared to be completely unhinged, drug addled and aimless.  At the age of 21 he appeared to not have any direction, much less one pointing him to "white supremacy".  How about the probability that he is a deranged stoner and misfit looking for his 15 minutes of "infamy" by committing this insanity.  How about the fact that crazies like this commit these types of crimes similar to the one in the theater in Colorado.  

We are igniting the fires of racial hatred as it seems to be the first conclusion reached in any conflict involving Black and white people in this country.  It is NOT 1961 people, this  should not be the first conclusion drawn.

How much better to use our conscience when we are reporting rather than enflaming situations and people in light of a tragedy.  and remember, the people of Norway and France were disarmed when a mass shooting took many lives.

Am I wrong on this one?

Dylann Roof, 21, identified by the FBI as the Charleston shooting suspect.

status_message:
Good Thursday Morning!

The Hatred of Faith

Clementa Carlos Pinckney (July 30, 1973 – June 17, 2015) was a Democratic member of the South Carolina Senate, representing the 45th District since 2000. He was previously a member of the South Carolina House of Representatives from 1997 through 2000.

Pinckney was a senior pastor at Mother Emanuel A.M.E. in Charleston. He died, along with eight members of the congregation, in a mass shooting at an evening bible study at his church on June 17, 2015.

Pinckney was born in Beaufort, South Carolina, the son of Theopia and John Pinckney.  His mother is deceased.

He graduated with a B.A. from Allen University in 1995 and went on to obtain a Master of Public Administration degree from the University of South Carolina in 1999.

Pinckney became pastor of Emanuel A.M.E Church in Charleston, South Carolina in 2010 and he was among several South Carolina pastors to hold rallies after the shooting of Walter Scott in 2015, attracting some local controversy.

Pinckney was first elected to the South Carolina General Assembly in 1996 at the age of 23, becoming the youngest African American elected as a South Carolina state legislator.[13] He served in the South Carolina House of Representatives until being elected to the South Carolina Senate in 2000. As a state senator, Pinckney pushed for laws to require police and other law enforcement officials to wear body cameras.

Pinckney's sister, whose name hasn't been released, was also shot at the church, according to ABC News 4. It was not immediately known if she was killed.

A humble man, Pinckney spoke about his inspirations in a 1999 profile by the Savannah Morning News, saying "In life, we are all faced with the opportunity to serve. It is at times a hard choice to make but those hard choices yield great rewards. Those rewards are mostly for others and not for ourselves. That's what service is all about."

Pinckney met the former Jennifer Benjamin in 1993 when he was a student at Allen University and she was at the University of South Carolina.  They married in 1999 and have two children, Eliana and Malana.

We don't know the rest of the victims, however, may Rep. Pinckney rest in peace and his family be comforted through the Lord.  May God welcome his glorious servant, Clementa Carlos Pinckney, home.

status_message:
Good Wednesday Afternoon!

The Great Escape.....

Last year when I visited San Francisco, I went on the little cruise around Alcatraz.  After watching the movie "Escape From Alcatraz" years ago, I was intrigued by the ability the caper.  

Alcatraz was supposed to be America's only escape-proof prison. Which is why, 50 years after three men vanished from inside its walls on June 11, 1962, the escape still fascinates. The Rock, an island set in the middle of San Francisco Bay, held the worst of the worst, including Frank Morris and John and Clarence Anglin (who were all serving life sentences for robbery, among other crimes). The men allegedly dug through the concrete fortress using a metal spoon (strengthened with silver from a dime) and an improvised drill crafted from a stolen vacuum cleaner. Adding to the intrigue, they smartly muffled the sound of their drilling with accordions played during music hour and left behind papier-mâché dummies — whose heads they topped with hair stolen from the prison barber shop — in their place. 

Though the prison claimed the men drowned at sea (which would thus maintain the belief that the penitentiary had no successful escapees in its 29 years of operation), their remains have never been found and the U.S. Marshal Service maintains an active case file on the trio. The break was the basis for the 1979 movie Escape from Alcatraz, starring Clint Eastwood.

I think that I was not the only person looking at the rough, very cold water surrounding the island and thinking that there could not be a way that any man or woman could possibly survive the water, but somehow I think they did.

The manhunt for Matt, 48, and Sweat, 35, is now in its 12th day. The pair broke out of the North Country maximum security prison near the Canadian border using power tools and, allegedly, assistance from prison worker Joyce Mitchell, 51.

Clinton Correctional Facility is a New York State Department of Correctional Services maximum security state prison for men located in the Village of Dannemora, New York.The prison itself is sometimes colloquially referred to as Dannemora, although its actual name is derived from its location in Clinton County, New York.

Built in 1844, it originally served as a site where prisoners were used to work in local mines in both Dannemora and nearby Lyon Mountain. This enterprise would not be profitable, and by 1877, mining had ended, and the prisoners were put to work on other trades. With this change, the prison experienced growth, and in 1887 it was given new concrete walls 30 feet tall that still stand. In 1892, the first prisoner was executed in the electric chair at the prison, beginning the use of capital punishment at Clinton Correctional. Twenty six men were executed between 1892 and 1913. This period also saw many prisoners cured of tuberculosis due in part to the clean air in the Adirondacks, leading to the importation of prisoners with this disease from other prisons.

Some of the current and past notorious residents of this prison include:

>Robert Chambers: the "preppy murderer", who served much of his sentence at Clinton Correctional Facility for the manslaughter conviction of Jennifer Levin, as well as a later sentence for drug possession after heroin was found in his cell and new criminal charges were brought.

>Julio Gonzalez: perpetrator of the 1990 Happy Land Fire in the Bronx which killed 87 people.

>Charles "Lucky" Luciano: One of the driving forces behind the development of Italian organized crime in the United States served 10 years of a 30- to 50-year sentence for running a prostitution ring before being deported to Italy after World War II.

>Eric Smith: Convicted of killing and sexually assaulting a four-year-old boy at age 13.

>Joel Steinberg: Attorney convicted for the abuse of his common law wife, Hedda Nussbaum, and the abuse murder of his four-year-old stepdaughter.

>2Pac (real name Tupac Shakur): Served 9 months on a sexual abuse conviction from February to October 1995 before being released on appeal.

>Joel Rifkin: referred to as "Joel the Ripper" by tabloids after a five-year killing spree. Murdered 17 women, and is serving 203 years to life.

More than 800 local, state and federal officers are popping open trunks, peering into cars and scouring heavily wooded areas. Canine units are also still searching for a scent that might lead police to Matt and Sweat, who escaped from the maximum-security facility known as "Little Siberia" in upstate New York on June 6.

Motion detectors and cameras have been placed in the woods, and an airplane able to fly at high altitude and detect movements on the ground is aiding in the search, a New York state official said. But despite promising leads, the official said, the search has gone cold.

And the longer it goes.... the colder the trail gets.

Clinton County District Attorney Andrew Wylie told the Associated Press that Mitchell was "Plan A" and, without a backup plan, he believes the escapees are still in the woods, farms or fields near Dannemora, N.Y. More than 800 law enforcement officials have been involved in a search that's largely focused on the towns of Cadyville, Saranc and Plattsburgh.

However, Clinton County Sheriff David Favro told CNN that Mitchell's getaway car was actually "Plan B." He suspected their elaborate plan had a more "fool-proof" strategy than relying on the woman who worked in the prison's tailoring shop

Sheriff Favro has modified his statement. He said the following to ABC News:  "I don't know if she was plan A, plan B, or plan C."

Pretty much,  I feel that Mitchell was never "Plan A", way too unstable.   She was the decoy.  They were long gone way before her designated pick up time.  The panic attack was gravy..... they knew she was capable of that.  They were done with her once she  ...provided tools and a cell phone and who knows what else,

Commemorating the first-ever escape in the facility's 170 year history, the men left behind a yellow sticky note on a pipe, with the message, "Have a nice day!"

Sweat, 35, was serving a life sentence without parole for killing a sheriff's deputy. Matt, 48, was doing 25 years to life for the 1997 kidnap, torture and hacksaw dismemberment of his former boss.  William Rickerson and Kevin Tarsia the original murder victims of this escaped duo will have justice deferred..... perhaps forever.

status_message:
Happy Birthday to:  M. C. Escher!!!!

17 June 1898 – 27 March 1972), usually referred to as M. C. Escher, was a Dutch graphic artist. He is known for his often mathematically inspired woodcuts, lithographs, and mezzotints. These feature impossible constructions, explorations of infinity, architecture, and tessellations.

Although Escher did not have mathematical training—his understanding of mathematics was largely visual and intuitive—Escher's work had a strong mathematical component, and more than a few of the worlds which he drew were built around impossible objects such as the Penrose triangle and the Penrose stairs. Many of Escher's works employed repeated tilings called tessellations. Escher's artwork is especially well liked by mathematicians and scientists, who enjoy his use of polyhedra and geometric distortions.

status_message:
Good Tuesday Afternoon!

Who was Sayyid Qutb and why Should We Know About Him?

Sayyid Qutb was born on October 8, 1906 in Asyut Governorate, Egypt.  He was an author, educator, Islamic theorist, poet..... among other things.  Qutb travelled through America from 1948 to 1950.  What was amazing about this short two year visit was that it provided him with a tremendous body of material.

He was shocked at the moral and spiritual degeneracy he observed during this short time, stating that "No one is more distant than the Americans from spirituality and piety."   This statement is bound to surprise since we, in America, often view this era as the height of American innocence and Christianity.Over a two year period he worked in several different institutions including what was then Wilson Teachers' College in Washington, D.C. and Colorado State College for Education in Greeley, as well as Stanford University. He also travelled extensively visiting the major cities of the United States and spent time in Europe on the return journey to Egypt. His reaction to the Western experience was decidedly negative; he found Western society hopelessly materialistic, corrupt, morally loose, and ridden with injustice. 

It was said that after he heard the jazz standard "Baby, It's Cold Outside" an ode to winter romance, he felt that it was the worst example of American hedonism.  After hearing the song at a Colorado church dance in the 1940s,  Sayyid Qutb viewed the song as a moral indictment of the West - views that some say could now shaped the future of the Middle East. 

Qutb was "scandalized" by the behavior we now view as quite prurient:  "Nobody goes to church as often as Americans do. . . . Yet no one is as distant as they are from the spiritual aspect of religion," he wrote in "The America I Have Seen," a 20-page tract he published in 1950. 

He was very critical of the American woman:  "The American girl is well acquainted with her body's seductive capacity. She knows it lies in the face, and in expressive eyes, and thirsty lips. She knows seductiveness lies in the round breasts, the full buttocks, and in the shapely thighs, sleek legs and she knows all this and does not hide it," he wrote.

He was critical of things he had observed in the United States: its materialism, individual freedoms, economic system, racism, brutal boxing matches, "poor" haircuts, superficiality in conversations and friendships, restrictions on divorce, enthusiasm for sports, lack of artistic feeling, "animal-like" mixing of the sexes (which "went on even in churches"), and strong support for the Israel.

In regards to the Arts, Sayyid Qutb wrote: 

"The American is primitive in his artistic taste, both in what he enjoys as art and in his own artistic works. "Jazz" music is his music of choice. This is that music that the Negroes invented to satisfy their primitive inclinations, as well as their desire to be noisy on the one hand and to excite bestial tendencies on the other."

His brother Muhammad and two of his sisters, Amīnah and Hamīdah, were also writers active in Islamic causes; all suffered arrest for their views along with their brother in 1965.

In his writings Sayyid Qutb attributed his strong bent towards religion to the influence of his parents. His mother, Fātimah Husayn 'Uthmān, had a particular love for the Koran (Qur'ān) which she inculcated in her offspring; she was determined that her children should all become buffāz (memorizers of the holy book). It was her custom to invite professional Koran reciters to the family home during the nights of the month of fasting (Ramadān), and Sayyid Qutb later recalled listening to the chanting of the sacred verses at his mother's side.

So......  why should we know about this man?  Why..... is he important?

 His experience in the U.S. is believed to have formed in part the impetus for his rejection of Western values and his move towards Islamism upon returning to Egypt. Resigning from the civil service, he joined the Muslim Brotherhood in the early 1950s and became editor-in-chief of the Brothers' weekly Al-Ikhwan al-Muslimin, and later head of its propaganda section, as well as an appointed member of the working committee and of its guidance council, the highest branch in the organization.

In 1966 he was convicted of plotting the assassination of Egyptian president Gamal Abdel Nasser and was executed by hanging.

 Qutb's short "excursion" in the United States hardened his views of the West's spiritual and moral bankruptcy - views that formed the basis for his more radical views about violence, jihad and the West.  He has been described by followers as a great thinker and martyr for Islam, while many Western observers see him as a key originator of Islamist ideology. Others in the West believe Qutb is an inspiration for violent groups such as al-Qaeda. Today, his supporters are identified as Qutbists or "Qutbi" (by their opponents, not by themselves).

Sayyid Qutb's mature political views always centered on Islam—Islam as a complete system of morality, justice and governance, whose sharia laws and principles should be the sole basis of governance and everything else in life - though his interpretation of it varied.  A staunch anti-Semite, he anything non-Islamic was evil and corrupt, while following sharia as a complete system extending into all aspects of life, would bring every kind of benefit to humanity, from personal and social peace, to the "treasures" of the universe.

Qutb had influence on Islamic insurgent/terror groups in Egypt and elsewhere. His influence on al-Qaeda was felt through his writing, his followers and especially through his brother, Muhammad Qutb, who moved to Saudi Arabia following his release from prison in Egypt and became a professor of Islamic Studies and edited, published and promoted his brother Sayyid's work.

Qutb dismissed Western achievements as entirely material, arguing that 'nothing will satisfy its own conscience and justify its existence....... many of the notorious names in the Islamic world were followers of his literature.  one of his central beliefs was that tno middle ground exists in what Qutb conceived as a struggle between God and Satan. All Muslim—as he defined them—therefore must take up arms in this fight. Any Muslim who rejects his ideas is just one more nonbeliever worthy of destruction.

Sometimes it is helpful to know the origin of certain types of thought....

status_message:
Good Monday Evening!

The  Origin of Race.......  (please do not comment without reading)

After such a spirited discussion today, I feel very "frisky" because we have now gotten to where I wanted to lead you.  Let's take a look at the concept of "race" from the Christian and non-Christian point of view and then YOU can come to your own conclusions......

How did the human race begin? The Scriptures introduce man as a created being. In Genesis 1:27 this truth is stated, "So God created man in his own image, in the image of God he created him; male and female he created them."   Evolution has no solution for the origin of life. Science never has been able to produce life out of that which was not life. 

In the creation of man he was made in the image and likeness of God (Gen. 1:27). There is no development in evolution could ever take an animal and produce in it that which corresponds to the image 
of God. 

Now, have been created "in the image of God",  the essential qualities of personality, intellect or mind, sensibility or feeling, and will, meaning the spirit of discernment as well as the ability to choose  is inherent in the abilities of those created in the image of God...... otherwise known as "man" and "woman".

Keep in mind that no other creature on this earth is in possession of ALL of these gifts......  Not a one.  Which is why "man" is "responsible" for his or her own actions.  Man is a creature with the developed sense of morals, a gift that makes "responsibility" possible.

Adam and Eve had "consciences" (developed from that heightened sense of morality and discernment ) that enabled them to distinguish right from wrong, however, that did not make them good, and their posterity drifted farther and farther from God until God decided to destroy the whole human race, except Noah and his family (Gen. 6:13). 

I know that I am missing a great deal of Scripture and "begets"  here but space and length does not allow.......  just follow along.  God gave to Noah the basic principles of human government. However, the human race again demonstrated its depravity by building the Tower of Babel,(to reach the sky and challenge God) and God had to judge by confusing the languages of the people.    The name "Babel" means "to confound".

After God  "confounded" the languages of all the people on earth. Genesis 10:5, states that God divided them in their lands by their family, and nation. The confounding of their languages was done in orderly fashion by God and families and tribes were given the same language. Noah's three sons are stated as being three divisions of man. Thus, at least three languages were needed to separate them and possibly many more. Some anthropologists believe that the languages found today developed from some forty to fifty earlier linguistic divisions.

Traditionally biblical scholars have concluded that the three races were the progeny of Noah's three sons, Shem, Japheth and Ham.

.  Japheth is the father of the Caucasian race;

.  Shem of the Mongoloid race; 

.  Ham of the Negroid race. 

So what is race?  RACE:   Any of the major biological divisions of mankind, distinguished by color and texture of hair, color of skin and eyes, stature, bodily proportions, etc: many ethnologists now consider that there are only three primary divisions, the Caucasian (loosely 'white race ), Negroid (loosely 'black race ) and Mongoloid (loosely, 'yellow race ), with various subdivisions: the term has acquired so many unscientific connotations that in this sense it is often replaced in scientific usage by 'ethnic stock  or 'group ."

The task of defining race is highly subjective and therefore, unscientific. We can consequently conclude that race is not clearly definable and is not a good term to use in describing variations among people.

So.......   "Are there races of men?" The difficulty of classifying man into races has been shown. Perhaps a better term would be "varieties" of man. Even evolutionary science concludes that all existing varieties of man are members of the SAME SPECIES.

Inter-racial marriages are common and children are produced with no biological difficulties. Prominent anthropologist, Ruth Benedict in her book, "Race: Science and Politics" stated the peoples of the earth are a single family and have a common origin.

IN OTHER WORDS, if all human beings have as their origin a single family and a common origin, AND if all races (if one believes in the Bible) are descendants of the three sons of Noah, the EQUALITY among the "races" exist in fact (not one brother is higher than the other).  So, in essence if all are of one family, with the "varieties" being present and not ACTUAL BIOLOGICAL differences, then the existence of "race' as we know it is simply a human construct, not one mandated by God.

Other Myths regarding race:

>  Once supposed biological differences, such as dissimilarity in blood, have proven to be incorrect. Blood is classified according to type, and all types are found within all supposed races of man. Blood transfusions are based on types A, B, AB, and O and are given without regard to race.

>  It has also been supposed that different races have differing intelligence levels. This false and racist idea concludes that the Caucasian race is the most intelligent with the Negroid race being the least intelligent. This idea originated with Charles Darwin's false, inflammatory, and evolutionary idea that man is a descendant of primates. He concluded quite unscientifically that the Negro is more closely related to monkeys and apes because they look more like a primate. Since a Caucasian looks the least like a primate, Darwin said they were higher up on the supposed evolutionary chain and was more intelligent. Often the Oriental is portrayed as being the more advanced species of man because of less body hair.

Is the Idea of Race Promulgated by the Bible?

 NO! NO! NO!  The term race does not appear in the Bible. The Bible refers to differing peoples in terms such as family, tribe, people and nation. It groups people according to familial relationships and then into nationalities.

So for those who Believe:  When God called Abraham, as Genesis 12:3 records, he stated that "In thee all the families of earth would be blessed." Genesis 22:18, says that from Abraham's seed ". . .all the nations of earth would be blessed." 

Not one of us is above the other and not one of us is separate from the other.  The human condition requires division because it is man's sometimes evil inner feelings to classify him/herself as "better" than that one "over there".  Superior, to others and thus more "God" or "Christ" - like.  These "divisions" are simply the figment of our "feeble" minds that we have trained to recognize the "gods" of false religion.  

It is not uncommon to hear Christians responding to this question with explanations, which have roots in evolution and other un-biblical teaching. Many times we hear false FAIRY TALES  such as: the tanning effects of the sun on people who settled in Africa causing the development of very dark skin; or people in the Far East (because of a more moderate climate) resulting in the development of the yellow tones of Oriental peoples; or Caucasian peoples of the Northern hemisphere having lighter or white skin because of being exposed to a lesser degree of sunlight. Other explanations often offered as the origin of race are the curse on Cain (Gen. 4:10-15) and on Ham's son Canaan (Gen. 9:20-25). Such explanations are false and are not supported by the Bible, or by science.Romans 10:11-13:

THESE ARE ALL FALSE.

     "For the scripture saith, Whosoever believeth on him shall not be ashamed. For there is no difference between the Jew and the Greek: for the same Lord over all is rich unto all that call upon him. For whosoever shall call upon the name of the Lord shall be saved" (Rom. 10:11-13).

     Both the Old and New Testaments show that God does not hold any significance to race. God sees all people as one people called "man." Physical characteristics are not a part of God's evaluation of man ". . .for man looketh on the outward appearance, but the Lord looketh on the heart" (I Samuel l6:7).

This is the story people, I know that I will hear so many fairy tales based upon individual fantasies of superior races and inferior intelligence but the truth is...... it really ain't true.  All of the evil which has passed on to their just rewards have now reaped what they sowed in ignorance and hatred.  

Finally, given the equality of races and the fact that the concept does not really exist........  how can anyone lie about it?  Further, given the evidence above, is it not truly blasphemous to think any different?

status_message:
Good Monday Morning!

Three Things that the Rachel Dolezal Story Tells Us About America's Race "Problem"

At first i was curious about this story.  I thought that It was interesting but never would I have imagined that this story would have taken on such a national flurry of stories, comments and in some cases outrage as the idea that a Caucasian woman should choose to live her life as a "Black" or "African-American" woman.    In short, I just want to highlight three points:

(1)  We are NOT living in a "Post -Racial" society.  While there are many stories, comments and "pickles" that needed "clarification" or apology by news characters and politicians alike, nothing has "captured" the air-waves with such angst and anger as the seemingly "preposterous" idea that a Caucasian woman with "peaches and cream" complexion, "naturally straw colored hair" and a "solid Caucasian, northern European" heritage (these were some of the descriptions that I have read), should relegate herself to an implicated "inferior" life of living as a Black woman, marrying a Black man and having Black children.  Her brother even suggested that she lived in "Black Face", which prompted me to check his age since  Blackface is a form of theatrical makeup used by performers to represent a black person. The practice gained popularity during the 19th century and contributed to the proliferation of stereotypes such as the "happy-go-lucky darky on the plantation" or the "dandified coon".  She was portraying neither stereotype and the suggestion of such FROM HER OWN FAMILY is breathtaking. 

This has also brought about a visceral responses from some people that I have known for more than just a short time.  One woman told me that she Just could not understand why an attractive white woman would do something like that to herself"....... she felt that Ms. Dolezal must be "psychotic" or at least "bi-polar".  A gentleman stated to me that his daughter's only "date" African American men and it was a "sexual thing".  I found that "uber" creepy and decided his name was to be deleted from my "contact list"..... permanently.  

Regardless of the response, the basic theme of "superiority" and "inferiority" abound.  "Passing" has been around for several centuries.  Other races have frequently "passed" for the dominant culture "white" in order to gain societal and economical advantages.  In the Caribbean and Africa, there are warnings given out  to people using "skin bleaches" which result in grey skin at best and skin cancer at worst.  There are more cultures on this earth that celebrate and promulgate the superiority of a lighter complexion over a darker one.  This is a fact.  But in America, the race issue has gone from "overt" with laws and structures protecting one race over another to "covert" inferences, rules and only occasional "slips"..... Such as when Senator Harry Reid is quoted in a new book as saying that Barack Obama ... black president because he was "light-skinned" with "no Negro dialect. Or when Vice President Biden called Obama first "clean" African-American candidate.  Both of these men are "liberal", espousing their  "love for the Blacks", yet they suggested that most Black men talked with an odd dialect and needed to take more showers or baths because they were naturally dirty.  

This obsession continues to the "hair texture".  There is more outrage regarding this woman's hair texture than anything else.  Why would she do this, seems to be the echo on both sides of the color spectrum......  This idea of "good" and "bad" hair texture can be summed up by a spectrum which states that the silkier and more "European" the hair texture, the more it falls into the "good hair" category".  The coarser, shorter and curlier......it is considered "bad".

(2)  We are hypocrites who lack perspective.  Bruce Jenner is a 65 year old father of six children, 6'2", thick boned Olympian, over 200 pounds and still in possession of his penis.  Yet we are willing, no gleeful to get a glimpse of his burly frame  in a maxi halter dress and kitten slippers on his veranda while vilifying anyone calling him anything but his new moniker "Caitlyn".  He poses on the front of Vanity Fair magazine with a "bathing beauty pinup model" suit worthy of a 1940's movie siren discretely hiding the "package".  

ESPN announced Monday that Jenner will be presented with the Arthur Ashe Courage Award at its annual award ceremony in Los Angeles this July. It will be broadcast at 8 p.m. July 15 on ABC.  Naturally, this broadcast will be watched with tears and misty eyes, yet what level of "bravery" is all of this showing?  And by the way there will be several people NOT watching this stunt......

That would be the woman whose vehicle was hit in the fatal car accident involving Caitlyn Jenner in February.  She  has filed a lawsuit against the Olympian formerly known as as Bruce Jenner.  Naming Bruce Jenner a/k/a Caitlyn Jenner in the civil case filed in Los Angeles on Monday, Jessica Steindorff is asking for compensatory and punitive damages. 

Also not watching would be Kim Howe who  died in the multi-vehicle crash when her car was knocked into oncoming traffic on the Pacific Coast Highway in Malibu. Jenner, 65, is also being sued for wrongful death by the two adult stepchildren of Howe, who was pronounced dead at the scene of the crash........  I guess they won't enjoy the awards program either.Apparently,Jenner's Escalade rear-ended Howe's Lexus, propelling it into the path of an oncoming Hummer.

We celebrate this person, his changes and his life while shunning another because of race.  We want taxpayers to pay for race changes in prison and for low income people wanting to switch but rabidly attack someone getting a tan, perm and declaring herself "black".

(3) We are blind...... at least when it comes to race..... on both ends of the spectrum.  In my family, I have people who from the outside have paler skin , straighter hair, and green or blue eyes.  These members of my family consider themselves as part of the "black" race.  Racial constructs have been used innocently as a means of classification and they have also been used for more sinister applications.  When you visit the Holocaust museum in Washington DC, you will discover that the Nazi's used clear classifications of races, so as to highlight the "superior" or Aryan race as it was.  The destruction of "others" were planned, based upon these classifications.  

One can argue that there are different cultures and sometimes these cultures do not mix harmoniously, however, cultural values, beliefs and constructs are often outside of the benign pigment that exists beneath the surface of our skin.  Until people understand that the "pigment" itself is not an indicator to "superiority or inferiority" this constant "twisting" will continue on.  It's effects on our society linger on and is often deleterious on our society as we see that the darker hues of our society appear to be over-represented in negative institutions such as prisons and ghettos as well as having negative upward means of mobility.  There are exceptions, but this has become the "rule".

status_message:
The NAACP  and the New Bru Ha Ha

The National Association for the Advancement of Colored People (NAACP) is an African-American civil rights organization in the United States, formed in 1909.   Its mission is "to ensure the political, educational, social, and economic equality of rights of all persons and to eliminate racial hatred and racial discrimination". Its name, retained in accordance with tradition, uses the once common term colored people.

The Race Riot of 1908 in Abraham Lincoln's hometown of Springfield, Illinois, had highlighted the urgent need for an effective civil rights organization in the U.S. This event is often cited as the catalyst for the formation of the NAACP.

.  Mary White Ovington, a white woman,  was born April 11, 1865, in Brooklyn, New York. Her grandmother attended the Connecticut congregation of Samuel Joseph May. Her parents, members of the Unitarian Church were supporters of women's rights and had been involved in anti-slavery movement. Educated at Packer Collegiate Institute and Radcliffe College, Ovington became involved in the campaign for civil rights in 1890 after hearing Frederick Douglass speak in a Brooklyn church.  She was a socialist.

.  William English Walling, a white man, was an American labor reformer and Socialist Republican born into a wealthy family in Louisville, Kentucky. He founded the National Women's Trade Union League in 1903. Moved by his investigation of a 1908 race riot in Springfield, Illinois, he was among the co-founders of the NAACP in 1909.and 

. Henry Moskowitz , a white  Jewish man,  born on September 25, 1879 in Romania. He was Jewish. He migrated to the United States in 1883. He attended the New York City public schools and then graduated from the City College of New York in 1899. In 1906 he earned a Ph.D. in philosophy from the University of Erlangen in Germany.

They met in New York City in January 1909 along with others and the NAACP was born.  

The NAACP issued a statement Friday in support of a local NAACP leader in Washington state who has been accused by her family of misrepresenting herself as black.

The civil rights group rushed to the defense of Rachel Dolezal, the head of the NAACP Spokane chapter, after the woman's parents told a newspaper Thursday her ancestry was white with some "faint traces" of Native American heritage.

Why they (her parents) did this, who knows? 

 But given the racial make-up of the original founders, "One's racial identity is not a qualifying criteria or disqualifying standard for NAACP leadership".  In fact it should not be an issue.  But what is an issue  of greater concern is the vitriol that accompanies a person's desire to identify themselves as an African American.  ………  In this country, a man can identify as a woman and a woman can identify as a man.  Same sex marriage is being represented as a "civil right", and a woman who can not [rove she is Native American is elected to the Senate.  

Given all of these situations………  why is it so outrageous that a white woman would consider herself as a Black woman?  Not only is it her business, it is less of a "stretch", given her appearance, causes and lifestyle for the last few years than any other aforementioned combination.

Let her be.

status_message:
The Story of Helga

She was the oldest of the six children taken by their parents, Joseph and Magda Goebbels, into Hitler's Berlin bunker on April 22 1945. Her name was Helga.

Faced with the inevitability of defeat, Goebbels, the Nazi Propaganda Minister, had determined to await defeat and death alongside the Fuhrer. Other leading Nazis had protected their children by sending them into the mountains or out of the country, but Magda Goebbels decided that she and the children would join her husband to bring their lives to what she called "the only possible and honourable conclusion".

Joseph Goebbels wrote almost every day of his adult life. His focus is his own importance in public events and his children feature rarely. When they do, he shows a chillingly distant delight in them: "I speak to the children on the telephone. They are all so sweet. How attached one can become to such tiny, insignificant beings!"

For a bright 12-year-old the signs of the desperation of the situation must have been obvious. Women and children who were fleeing from the advancing Russian army streamed past their home, bringing stories of atrocities. 

At the end of 1944 Goebbels commissioned a propaganda film about his two oldest girls, Helga and Hilde, visiting a military hospital, and giving the soldiers flowers. The girls were so visibly horrified by the mutilated patients that the project had to be abandoned.
From 1944-45 the children lived with  a nanny and their grandmothers in the Goebbels' rural residence of Waldhof am Bogensee. Joseph was mostly in Berlin, Magda often with him. Diaries describe the excitement of the children when he came home, but also how he "liked to tease the children", particularly the only boy, nine-year-old Helmut.

Both grandmothers lived in log cabins on the Bogensee estate. Magda's mother Auguste, who avoided all contact with Joseph, whom she hated, was suicidal and alarmed  the children, with her constant wailing. Every Sunday the children would visit their Goebbels grandmother and sing to her. Katherina Goebbels was very critical of her son the Reich Minister, always asking in her strong Rhineland accent, '"What has that boy done now?"

Helga was always said to be Hitler's "favorite little girl". No one elaborates on this nor has much been written as to why but this was the case from the age of 3 on according to the documents.  She was always given attention, especially on the occasion of his birthday.

On May 1 1945, one of Hitler's doctors, Ludwig Stumpfegger, who helped Magda crush cyanide tablets between the children's teeth as they slept.  When the first Russians entered the bunker two days later they discovered the children's bodies. They were lying in their beds wearing white nightclothes, completely unmarked, except for Helga. According to the autopsy the Russians carried out, bruising on her face indicated that force had been needed to administer the cyanide to her. 

Helga, the eldest of Joseph's children, was only twelve when she was murdered by her own parents. Hilde was eleven. Helmut was nine, Holde was eight, Hedda almost seven, and Heide just four.

The pictures of Hitler and Helga are hard to look at.... by today's standards.....

status_message:
Happy Birthday to:  Anne Frank

Annelies Marie "Anne" Frank 

12 June 1929 – February 1945 was a diarist and writer. She is one of the most discussed Jewish victims of the Holocaust. Her wartime diary The Diary of a Young Girl has been the basis for several plays and films. Born in the city of Frankfurt in Weimar Germany, she lived most of her life in or near Amsterdam, in the Netherlands. Born a German national, Frank lost her citizenship in 1941. She gained international fame posthumously after her diary was published. It documents her experiences hiding during the German occupation of the Netherlands in World War II.

The Frank family moved from Germany to Amsterdam in 1933, the year the Nazis gained control over Germany. By May 1940, they were trapped in Amsterdam by the German occupation of the Netherlands. As persecutions of the Jewish population increased in July 1942, the family went into hiding in some concealed rooms behind a bookcase in the building where Anne's father worked. After two years, the group was betrayed and transported to concentration camps. Anne Frank and her sister, Margot Frank, were eventually transferred to the Bergen-Belsen concentration camp, where they died (probably of typhus) in February or March 1945.

Otto Frank, the only survivor of the family, returned to Amsterdam after the war to find that Anne's diary had been saved by one of the helpers, Miep Gies, and his efforts led to its publication in 1947. It has since been translated into many languages. It was translated from its original Dutch version and first published in English in 1952 as The Diary of a Young Girl. The diary, which was given to Anne on her thirteenth birthday, chronicles her life from 12 June 1942 until 1 August 1944.  Wikipedia

I read the diary when I was in the 4th grade and never forgot it.

status_message:
Good Friday Morning!

Carly Fiorina is a Force!

It is time, it is time.  I have been somewhat under the weather for the past week, suffering from my annual bronchitis malady.  In between trying to fight it off by walking, yoga and stretching, I have had long bouts of laying in bed listening to ALL of the news stations.  At roughly 4:00 am or so, Brett Bair was interviewing Carly Fiorina.  My desire to get out an walk was met by my greater fear of small crawling animals such as raccoons or hedgehogs of muskrats or burrowing owls, or skunks, or .......  any other critter with small beady eyes.  So I settled in with some tea and watched Ms. Fiorina.  

Her demeanor is very self possessed, calm and assured.  She spoke with authority and knowledge leaving out overemphasis, histrionics or emotionalism.  She was the epitome of a professional, an executive and a contender.  She was "on point" and answered each and every question posed to her with aplomb.  No "heartstrings" stories....... evoking false sounds of strange accents, Black poetry , imaginary immigrant family members, or entreaties for the public to vote for her "because she is a woman".  I could not imagine her "bugging" her eyes from her head, balling up plump little fists  and screaming "what difference does it make" in reference to men dying in a place called Benghazi.

"The nation is at a pivotal point," said Fiorina. "The gulf between how people feel about their lives and what's going on in Washington is huge. The disconnect between regular people and the political class is wide and growing." Yahoo News

At an event in Washington, D.C., Thursday evening, the former Hewlett-Packard CEO will argue that conservatives should embrace a term that some shy away from, according to her prepared remarks.  

She is bold enough to tout "feminism".  

Feminism began as a rallying cry to empower women," she will say at the Competitive Enterprise Institute. "But over the years, feminism has devolved into a left-leaning political ideology where women are pitted against men and used as a political weapon to win elections."

And we, on the right have fallen into the left's narrative by coining such phrases as "Femi-Nazi" which then makes us look as though we want to tether women barefooted to the birthing table and the kitchen table.

Ms. Fiorina offered her own definition: "A feminist is a woman who lives the life she chooses. … A woman may choose to have five children and home-school them. She may choose to become a CEO, or run for President."

You go, girl..........  THIS is a woman I want MY daughter's to listen to.  Her message is wayyyyyyy too important to miss.  For the right side of the aisle to remain viable, we must neutralize the ideas and attacks coming from the left that emphasize "the war on women" or the incorrect claim that the party is composed of "old , rich, Caucasian men" ............  because as long as that is all the public might see, that is all they will perceive.  And as we all know:

Perceptions are reality.... and ..."Reality is merely an illusion, albeit a very persistent one." – Albert Einstein

status_message:
Landmark Case June 12, 1967:  Loving v. Virginia

Loving v. Virginia, 388 U.S. (1967), is a landmark civil rights decision of the United States Supreme Court, which invalidated laws prohibiting interracial marriage.

The case was brought by Mildred Loving, a black woman, and Richard Loving, a white man, who had been sentenced to a year in prison in Virginia for marrying each other. Their marriage violated the state's anti-miscegenation statute, the Racial Integrity Act of 1924, which prohibited marriage between people classified as "white" and people classified as "colored". The Supreme Court's unanimous decision determined that this prohibition was unconstitutional, reversing Pace v. Alabama (1883) and ending all race-based legal restrictions on marriage in the United States.

The decision was followed by an increase in interracial marriages in the U.S., and is remembered annually on Loving Day, June 12. It has been the subject of two movies, as well as several songs. Beginning in 2013, it was cited as precedent in U.S. federal court decisions holding restrictions on same-sex marriage in the United States unconstitutional.

Chief Justice Earl Warren's opinion for the unanimous court held that:

"Marriage is one of the "basic civil rights of man," fundamental to our very existence and survival.... To deny this fundamental freedom on so unsupportable a basis as the racial classifications embodied in these statutes, classifications so directly subversive of the principle of equality at the heart of the Fourteenth Amendment, is surely to deprive all the State's citizens of liberty without due process of law. The Fourteenth Amendment requires that the freedom of choice to marry not be restricted by invidious racial discrimination. Under our Constitution, the freedom to marry, or not marry, a person of another race resides with the individual and cannot be infringed by the State."

"There is patently no legitimate overriding purpose independent of invidious racial discrimination which justifies this classification. The fact that Virginia prohibits only interracial marriages involving white persons demonstrates that the racial classifications must stand on their own justification, as measures designed to maintain White Supremacy."

Associate Justice Potter Stewart filed a brief concurring opinion. He reiterated his opinion from McLaughlin v. Florida that "it is simply not possible for a state law to be valid under our Constitution which makes the criminality of an act depend upon the race of the actor."

Background:

Mildred Loving was partially African American and Native American. Throughout her life, she referred to herself as Indian rather than black. Mildred's family had deep roots in the area around Central Point, Virginia, where blacks and whites mixed freely with little racial tension even at the height of the Jim Crow era.

As a girl, Mildred was so skinny, she was nicknamed "Bean." She was just 11 years old and attending an all-black school when she first met Richard Loving, a 17-year-old white high school student. Quietly, the two fell in love and began dating and when Mildred became pregnant at the age of 18, the two decided to get married.

Virginia's Racial Integrity Act of 1924 (known as an anti-miscegenation law) barred the Lovings from marrying in their home state, so the couple drove 90 miles north to Washington, D.C. to tie the knot and then returned to their home in Caroline County, Virginia. They'd been married just a few weeks when, in the early morning hours of July 11, 1958, the county sheriff and two deputies, acting on an anonymous tip that the Lovings were in violation of the law, stormed into the couple's bedroom.

"Who is this woman you're sleeping with?" the sheriff asked the startled Richard Loving. Mildred offered up the answer: "I'm his wife." When she pointed to the couple's marriage certificate hanging on the wall, the sheriff coldly replied, "That's no good here."

Richard ended up spending a night in jail, the pregnant Mildred several more, and the couple eventually pleaded guilty to violating the Virginia law, which recognized citizens as "pure white" only if they could claim white lineage all the way back to 1684.

"Almighty God created the races white, white, black, yellow, malay and red, and he placed them on separate continents," presiding Judge Leon M. Bazile ruled.

For Richard Loving, the argument was a simple one: 

"Tell the court I love my wife, and it is just unfair that I can't live with her in Virginia." 

On June 12, 1967, the high court agreed unanimously in favor of the Lovings, striking down Virginia's law.

Richard and Mildred soon moved back to Virginia, returning to Caroline County, where they built a home and raised their children. Tragically, Richard was killed in an automobile accident in 1975, when his car was struck by another vehicle operated by a drunk driver. Mildred, who was also in the car, lost sight in her right eye.

Mildred continued to shy away from the attention and granted very few interviews."What we wanted, we wanted to come home." to Virginia ...lawfully.....

Mildred Loving passed away from pneumonia on May 2, 2008, at the age of 68. "Loving Day" on June 12, informally.

 Alberto Iber posted  in regards to the "dust-up" in McKinney Texas.

"He did nothing wrong. He was afraid for his life. I commend him for his actions."

Then this happened:

On Wednesday, Miami-Dade Public Schools announced Iber's removal and that they were looking for his replacement. The statement said that school employees are held to a higher standard and are required to conduct themselves, both personally and professionally, in a manner that represents the school district's core values.

"Judgment is the currency of honesty," said Superintendent of Schools Alberto M. Carvalho. "Insensitivity – intentional or perceived – is both unacceptable and inconsistent with our policies, but more importantly with our expectation of common sense behavior that elevates the dignity and humanity of all, beginning with children."

For "perceived insensitivity", this educator loses his job.  I sincerely hope that he sues the school district for as much as he can get.  This is the definition of insanity.

http://www.nbcmiami.com/news/local/North-Miami-Senior-High-School-Principal-Alberto-Iber-Loses-Job-Over-Post-on-Police-Incident-in-McKinney-Texas-306816711.html

status_message:
Jeannette Pickering Rankin (June 11, 1880 – May 18, 1973) was the first woman elected to the United States Congress, in 1916 and again in 1940, from the state of Montana. After winning her House seat in 1916 she said, "I may be the first woman member of Congress but I won't be the last."

Rankin's two terms in Congress coincided with U.S. entry into both World Wars. A lifelong pacifist, she was one of 56 members of Congress who voted against entry into World War I in 1917, and the only member of Congress to vote against declaring war on Japan after the attack on Pearl Harbor in 1941.In addition, she was the only woman to cast a Congressional vote in favor of the Constitutional Amendment granting women unconditional voting rights.

status_message:
Meet the New Miss Japan!  Ariana Miyamoto

Japan, which consists of 98% Japanese nationals, is one of the most homogeneous societies on this earth.  This young lady is the epitome of determination and "chutzpah".......  having endured much of what none of us in America have witnessed.... at least not in the last 50 years.

Miyamoto was born and raised in Japan. Her mother is Japanese and her father is an African American who was stationed at the U.S. naval base in Sasebo, Japan.

As a child, Miyamoto endured daily discrimination and racial taunts. Two decades later, in her new high-profile role, she is facing down that same bigotry.

"In school I had trash thrown at me and was laughed at, and everyone pretended not to notice. When I was talking to my friends in the classroom, both boys and girls would be told not to talk to me," she said.

On field trips and especially in the swimming pools, the children tried not to hold hands with her or even rub up against her because they were afraid that her color would rub off on their fair skin.

 Miyamoto's selection won favorable reviews for the most part, many anonymous critics took to Japanese social media, attacking her looks, challenging her stand on racial issues and questioning whether someone with a mixed racial background should represent Japan.he fact that Miyamoto is of mixed race, or a "hafu", has drawn negative backlash from Japanese audiences who feel that Miss Japan should be pure Japanese.

Many Japanese seem to struggle with the concept of discrimination. A court in Kyoto recently ruled that it is permissible for landlords to refuse to rent to foreigners or non-Japanese — based on nothing more than race or ethnicity.

She stated that was precisely why at the age of 21 she decided to pursue the title.  In addition she learned that no biracial person had ever entered the Miss Universe-Japan pageant, let alone won.

We will be watching this fabulous lady!

http://thesource.com/2015/06/10/controversy-surrounding-first-mixed-race-miss-japan/

http://www.wtsp.com/story/news/2015/05/30/japan-miss-universe-ariana-miyamoto-fights-bi-racial-bias/28213589/
